column1: 4260409286,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-scalapay-4260409286?position=1&pageNum=0&refId=uBpCfe5q2i%2B18hBlyebQZQ%3D%3D&trackingId=ai5FrTLldZe0q0vL0rNeLA%3D%3D,Data Analyst,Scalapay,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Thanks to our innovative BuyNow PayLater payment solution, Scalapay is transforming the way more than 6.5 million customers buy online and in-store, empowering 8,000+ merchants (online and in-store) to give their customers magical shopping experiences.

Being only 3 years old didn‚Äôt stop us from becoming a unicorn ü¶Ñ We have raised over $700mln and we did this thanks to a team built around our 4 core values: #MakeItHappen #PlayAsATeam #StayCurious #FocusOnCustomer.
This is where your magic happens. If you love it, Scalapay it ‚ô•

Our data team seeks a Data Analyst who will champion a 'data-first' mindset, ensuring precise measurement and reporting of relevant metrics. This role collaborates closely with Scalapay‚Äôs key Business Units such as Product, Marketing and Sales, employing technical expertise to translate concepts into concrete outcomes.
Serve as the data point of reference for our key Business Units, providing them with necessary support
Use advanced analytical tools to assess and interpret sales and marketing data, measuring the effectiveness of activities and pinpointing areas for improvement
Build and maintain comprehensive reports and dashboards for our teams to facilitate data-driven decision-making
Translate business questions into analytical solutions, providing actionable insights
Ensure accuracy and reliability in measuring key performance indicators (KPIs) and the underlying data
Identify trends, patterns, and areas for improvement in order to propose data-driven recommendations to optimise marketing strategies and sales processes
Conduct hands-on work with data, including data cleansing, transformation, and validation
Help us extend a data-driven mindset throughout Scalapay
Be an active member of the Data team, helping to develop and enhance our suite of Business Intelligence tooling.
You‚Äôll be great for this role if:
You have a minimum of 3 years of experience in a data-driven role, ideally with a background in startups or fintech
You have strong SQL skills, Python is a plus
You are proficient in data visualisation tools and data storytelling
You have a background in statistics and can conduct experiments or validate hypotheses
You are fluent in Italian and English: you must be totally confident talking and sharing results in English in a sharp and concise way
You demonstrate outstanding communication skills, both verbally and in writing. You excel at simplifying complex topics into straightforward solutions and ideas
You‚Äôre more than data-driven, you are obsessed with data!
Attractive packages based on skills and experience - the salary we have for this position is up to 40'000‚Ç¨ (Gross Annual Base)
International environment with significant challenges to be met every day
Lots of opportunities to work with a team of industry tech leaders who are focused on delivering products that offer exceptional user experiences
Personalised support to accelerate your professional growth and take ownership of the products you deliver: we want to help you grow!
Latest technologies and being encouraged to bring your flair to the role.
Initial Chat: A brief conversation with our Talent Acquisition team
Hiring Manager Interview: A deep dive into your experience and motivation for the role
Case Study: A skills-based test with a debriefing session involving key stakeholders
Final Chat with Simone (CEO): An opportunity to discuss Scalapay‚Äôs values and assess cultural alignment.
Want to learn more? Don't hesitate to explore our Careers website, our LinkedIn and Glassdoor pages.
Pro tip: send your CV in English üòâ
Super Pro tip: we know that application processes can be scary and frustrating but‚Ä¶ we look for talent, not people that tick all our boxes.
We believe in the power of diversity: Scalapay is an Equal Opportunity Employer for any minority, disability, gender identity or sexual orientation.

Do Work That Matters - Your Role and Responsibilities

Do you want to do work that is truly meaningful and impactful? At KPMG, you will have the opportunity to help clients, society, and your colleagues tackle and solve the most current and complex challenges.

The Digital Assurance Team is KPMG‚Äôs innovative team which brings together different skill sets to shape the digitalization of the future for assurance and audit services. You will have the opportunity to work alongside expert auditors ‚Äì through in-house courses and especially on-the-job training ‚Äì developing the ability to critically analyse the company processes used in financial reporting and the information processed by the companies‚Äô IT systems, identifying errors and interpreting the dynamics underlying financial performance.
Specifically, you will be tasked with:
The development of analytics solutions for audit teams (transactional analytics, dashboards for the analysis of accounting data, process mining, process KPIs, etc.)
The development of audit techniques based on the use of innovative technological solutions
Assistance to the audit teams in using the new solutions
The organization of communication initiatives to raise awareness of the project/solutions.
Come As You Are - Your Skills and Characteristics
This is the perfect opportunity for you if:
You have a business/accounting background with a degree in business subject
You have a strong interest in financial reporting and data analytics
You have a desire to learn and challenge yourself
You want to grow within an International Network
Your Future With Us - What You Will Find at KPMG
An inclusive and equitable work environment that respects, encourages, and values diversity.
A challenging and dynamic environment that encourages creativity and teamwork. [NL1]
Hybrid work arrangements to promote a healthy work-life balance.
Advanced training and development programs to stay current.
Initiatives focused on physical and mental well-being.
Together for Better ‚Äì Our Values and Commitment

Leadership, teamwork, respect for individuality, continuous learning, transparency, community engagement, integrity: these are the values of KPMG that create an environment open to the exchange of ideas and knowledge, allowing our professionals to express their full potential.

As a result of our commitment to fostering an inclusive work environment, our Network complies with the standards of the ISO 30415 requirements, on the Diversity and Inclusion Management System, and UNI PdR 125, relating to gender equality.

Your data will be processed in full compliance with the provisions of Regulation (EU) no. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - ‚ÄúGDPR‚Äù), as amended. For more information, please see KPMG‚Äôs privacy policy .
KPMG S.p.A. is an equal opportunity employer.

4259401998,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/junior-data-analyst-milano-cagliari-at-deloitte-4259401998?position=4&pageNum=0&refId=uBpCfe5q2i%2B18hBlyebQZQ%3D%3D&trackingId=4Q%2BCyhIeSSFh51GEuDPf%2BA%3D%3D,Junior - Data Analyst Milano/Cagliari,Deloitte,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Sei pronto a #MakeAnImpactThatMatters nel nostro team Audit & Assurance?

Entrando nel Team di Deloitte Data Analytics Audit&Assurance avrai l‚Äôoccasione di crescere e sviluppare forti competenze trasversali, lavorando su progetti sfidanti e collaborando con moltissimi clienti.

Con la supervisione dei colleghi e colleghe pi√π esperti, sarai responsabile delle attivit√† progettuali nelle quali sarai coinvolto, e della qualit√† del tuo lavoro e del tuo allineamento alle priorit√†, agli obiettivi e alle esigenze dei clienti.
Grazie a questa esperienza, potrai acquisire un bagaglio culturale utile e ampio in questo ambito operando in una realt√† leader nel settore.

In quanto Analyst avrai la possibilit√† di imparare dai colleghi pi√π Senior (attraverso il learning on the job) e sviluppare competenze tecniche e relazionali lavorando in un contesto stimolante, che comporta sfide impegnative con ottime prospettive professionali.
Raccogliere, analizzare e interpretare dati provenienti da diverse fonti, mediante l‚Äôutilizzo di strumenti quali Excel, SQL, Python.

Analizzare, interpretare dati e fornire insights per il miglioramento dei processi aziendali
Grazie all‚Äôufficio Learning avrai modo di seguire corsi e attivit√† di formazione che ti permetteranno di ampliare e approfondire le tue conoscenze.

I colleghi del Talent invece, si occuperanno in maniera strutturata del tuo avanzamento di carriera con KPI e obiettivi definiti, che se raggiunti, ti garantiranno la revisione del grade e degli economics.
Laurea in Ingegneria, Informatica, Matematica, Fisica, Data Science
Competenze di base in analisi dei dati, statistiche e metodologie di data mining
Conoscenza dei concetti di organizzazione di un Data Warehouse
Conoscenza di strumenti di analisi dati come Excel, SQL
Conoscenza dei linguaggi di programmazione per l'analisi dei dati (es. Python, R)
Spiccate capacit√† analitiche e attitudine al problem-solving
Disponibilit√† a viaggiare in Italia e all‚Äôestero
Esperienza su strumenti quali SQL Server, Power BI, Qlik, PowerPlatform
Conoscenza delle principali tecniche di machine learning, deep learning e NLP
Esperienza nell‚Äôutilizzo di librerie di machine learning come Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch, etc.
Vorresti intraprendere una carriera professionale nel mondo della consulenza, dove la parola d‚Äôordine √®: crescita
L‚Äôidea di trasformare un problema in opportunit√† ti stimola
Ti ritieni una persona empatica e quindi disponibile ad accogliere le diverse esigenze dei tuoi colleghi e degli stakeholder interni ed esterni
Ti piacerebbe imparare ad avere una visione progettuale d‚Äôinsieme, tenendo sempre a mente l‚Äôoperativit√† per raggiungere gli obiettivi con integrit√† e rispetto degli standard Deloitte
Ti piace lavorare in un ambiente sfidante in cui le priorit√† possono cambiare quotidianamente

Siamo impegnati a ridurre i nostri impatti e incoraggiamo le persone ad assumere comportamenti sostenibili. Per salvaguardare l‚Äôambiente e limitare il climate change, abbiamo sviluppato la strategia WorldClimate, attraverso la quale ci siamo posti l‚Äôobiettivo di diventare una Net Zero.
Join our #iAct movement! Fai il quiz per calcolare la tua carbon footprint e scopri come adottare dei comportamenti pi√π responsabili.
Se vuoi scoprire come sar√† il processo di selezione, guarda questo video.

Sedi di lavoro: Milano o Cagliari
Saranno prese in considerazione tutte le candidature indistintamente, nel rispetto dei nostri valori ed in linea con la nostra cultura inclusiva.

Deloitte √® una societ√† leader mondiale nei servizi professionali presente in oltre 150 Paesi. Il suo scopo √® fornire ai propri clienti gli strumenti necessari per affrontare le pi√π complesse sfide di business.

Deloitte valorizza tutte le diversit√† come fonte di innovazione e ricchezza individuale e collettiva. Per saperne di pi√π:

Il nome Deloitte si riferisce a una o pi√π delle seguenti entit√†: Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Limited, una societ√† inglese a responsabilit√† limitata (‚ÄúDTTL‚Äù), le member firm aderenti al suo network e le entit√† a esse correlate. DTTL e ciascuna delle sue member firm sono entit√† giuridicamente separate e indipendenti tra loro. DTTL (denominata anche ‚ÄúDeloitte Global‚Äù) non fornisce servizi ai clienti. Assurance avrai l‚Äôoccasione di crescere e sviluppare forti competenze trasversali, lavorando su progetti sfidanti e collaborando con moltissimi clienti.

Con la supervisione dei colleghi e colleghe pi√π esperti, sarai responsabile delle attivit√† progettuali nelle quali sarai coinvolto, e della qualit√† del tuo lavoro e del tuo allineamento alle priorit√†, agli obiettivi e alle esigenze dei clienti.

Grazie a questa esperienza, potrai acquisire un bagaglio culturale utile e ampio in questo ambito operando in una realt√† leader nel settore.

#YourRole

In quanto Analyst avrai la possibilit√† di imparare dai colleghi pi√π Senior (attraverso il learning on the job) e sviluppare competenze tecniche e relazionali lavorando in un contesto stimolante, che comporta sfide impegnative con ottime prospettive professionali.

In Particolare, Ti Occuperai Di:

  • Raccogliere, analizzare e interpretare dati provenienti da diverse fonti, mediante l‚Äôutilizzo di strumenti quali Excel, SQL, Python.
  • Sviluppare report e dashboard tramite i principali tool di BI (es. PowerBI, Qlik Sense, Qlik Cloud,‚Ä¶).
  • Supportare nell‚Äôorganizzazione e gestione dei dataset su database relazionali e NoSQL.
  • Analizzare, interpretare dati e fornire insights per il miglioramento dei processi aziendali

Grazie all‚Äôufficio Learning avrai modo di seguire corsi e attivit√† di formazione che ti permetteranno di ampliare e approfondire le tue conoscenze.

I colleghi del Talent invece, si occuperanno in maniera strutturata del tuo avanzamento di carriera con KPI e obiettivi definiti, che se raggiunti, ti garantiranno la revisione del grade e degli economics.

#WinningRequirements

  • Laurea in Ingegneria, Informatica, Matematica, Fisica, Data Science
  • Competenze di base in analisi dei dati, statistiche e metodologie di data mining
  • Conoscenza dei concetti di organizzazione di un Data Warehouse
  • Conoscenza di strumenti di analisi dati come Excel, SQL
  • Conoscenza dei linguaggi di programmazione per l'analisi dei dati (es. Python, R)
  • Spiccate capacit√† analitiche e attitudine al problem-solving
  • Propensione al lavoro in team
  • Ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese
  • Disponibilit√† a viaggiare in Italia e all‚Äôestero

#NiceToHave

  • Esperienza su strumenti quali SQL Server, Power BI, Qlik, PowerPlatform
  • Conoscenza delle principali tecniche di machine learning, deep learning e NLP
  • Esperienza nell‚Äôutilizzo di librerie di machine learning come Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch, etc.

#LoveWorkingAtDeloitteIf

  • Vorresti intraprendere una carriera professionale nel mondo della consulenza, dove la parola d‚Äôordine √®: crescita
  • L‚Äôidea di trasformare un problema in opportunit√† ti stimola
  • Ti ritieni una persona empatica e quindi disponibile ad accogliere le diverse esigenze dei tuoi colleghi e degli stakeholder interni ed esterni
  • Ti piacerebbe imparare ad avere una visione progettuale d‚Äôinsieme, tenendo sempre a mente l‚Äôoperativit√† per raggiungere gli obiettivi con integrit√† e rispetto degli standard Deloitte
  • Ti piace lavorare in un ambiente sfidante in cui le priorit√† possono cambiare quotidianamente
  • Ami lavorare in team

#MakeanImpactThatMatters

Siamo impegnati a ridurre i nostri impatti e incoraggiamo le persone ad assumere comportamenti sostenibili. Per salvaguardare l‚Äôambiente e limitare il climate change, abbiamo sviluppato la strategia WorldClimate, attraverso la quale ci siamo posti l‚Äôobiettivo di diventare una Net Zero.

Join our #iAct movement! Fai il quiz per calcolare la tua carbon footprint e scopri come adottare dei comportamenti pi√π responsabili.

Se vuoi scoprire come sar√† il processo di selezione, guarda questo video.

Se vuoi prepararti ad incontrare i nostri Recruiter iscriviti alla nostra piattaforma gratuita di orientamento al lavoro.

Do you strive for excellence, but are also capable to find the right trade-off between time taken to deliver and the quality of the end result?
Do you perform best when working in a team, but are also willing to go solo when needed?

If you answered ‚Äúyes - that‚Äôs me!‚Äù to the questions above, then you should join Softlab‚Äôs Digital Marketing & Sales Practice as Digital Data Analyst (remote-first role, contractually based in Milano): you‚Äôll be working closely with our clients‚Äô teams to provide key data insights, using state-of-art digital analytics tools, that drive business decisions impacting both online and offline channels.
In Softlab, you‚Äôll be free to express your full potential working with our top-tier clients and having a real impact on the growth of our company.
Bring together data from multiple sources, leverage it to identify unspotted behaviours and drive changes based on actionable insights
Use available digital & non-digital data for answering any analytics-related question coming from business stakeholders
Translate high-level commercial requests into meaningful KPIs, and then in metrics and dimensions that can be measured
Present the results of your analyses being able to summarize the key insights, but also to drill down in the details
Proactively push to improve the status quo by experimenting with data analysis
Good knowledge of SAS, SQL, R, Python or similar solution for data analysis
Preferred: hands-on experience with digital analytics tools usage (e.g. Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics)
Good experience with other office tools (Outlook, Word, PowerPoint)
Attention to details, ability to meet deadlines, manage multiple priorities, and work in a team
Proficiency in Italian and English languages (written & spoken)
Preferred: statistics, mathematics, engineering, or similar STEM university background
Stimulating experience in a dynamic consulting company: you will learn a lot and grow based on your performance
Pleasant environment, where the team generates value for our clients and builds strong relationships: you will always receive support and feel welcomed as a member of the Softlab family
Exciting work with innovative technologies and solutions: you will develop hard and soft skills that will always come handy, and will help defining advanced standards and best practices
Remote-ready work: if the project allows it, you‚Äôll have the possibility to work wherever there is a reliable Internet connection (the role will be contractually based in Milano)
We are a company certified for Gender Equality (Uni/PdR 125:2022). This position is open to all individuals who meet the technical requirements, regardless of gender.
We believe that teams composed of diverse individuals generate better ideas and help us understand and support our clients more effectively. That‚Äôs why we ensure equal opportunities for everyone.

4249166385,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-dentsu-creative-italy-4249166385?position=14&pageNum=0&refId=uBpCfe5q2i%2B18hBlyebQZQ%3D%3D&trackingId=V73sGZ2A0H2pXR%2BRX%2B3t8Q%3D%3D,Data analyst,Dentsu Creative Italy,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Dentsu Creative is a global creative agency network designed to unlock exponential growth for clients. We use Transformative Creativity as a differentiating, driving force to bring our capabilities together to positively impact people, business and society.
Established in 2022, Dentsu Creative is integrated with dentsu‚Äôs Media and CXM businesses in over 145 countries and regions, to offer Integrated Growth Solutions.
We are looking for a Data Analyst to be employed in our Milan office.

We are looking for Data Analyst with boundless curiosity and a deep passion for data and innovation. Someone who not only sees the numbers, but also understands the people behind them ‚Äî a professional who blends analytical rigor with a humanistic lens on the world.

As a Data Analyst within Dentsu Creative‚Äôs award-winning strategy team, you will dive deep into numbers to decode what‚Äôs really happening around us. With a sharp analytical eye and the ability to see connections beyond the numbers, you read and interpret data to uncover the forces shaping culture, behaviours, and brands ‚Äî turning complex information into clear, strategic insights that inspire bold and impactful thinking and creativity.

You will work closely with all the Dentsu Creative verticals (Brand Strategy, Advertising, Events, Luxury, Gaming, Social, Influencer Marketing, and more) as a true 360¬∫ expert of consumer, industry and cultural trends & insights, developing insights and point of views for some of the biggest Global and Italian brands.

From insight reports to sweeping innovation projects, we're looking for someone who‚Äôs curious about the world ‚Äî someone who questions assumptions, challenges conventions, and uses data to reframe challenges and find unexpected answers.
Analyze and present reports on digital and social performance, turning data into clear, actionable insights.
Conduct social listening analysis to identify conversation patterns, audience and brand insight.
Support the design and development of ad hoc surveys to uncover strategic insights and inform brand decision-making.
Monitor key trends and shifts, providing analysis that supports teams across dentsu with culturally informed thinking.
Help develop analysis packages for clients, supporting the creation of tailored research proposals in collaboration with different Dentsu teams.
Strategic thinker with a strong analytical mindset and a deep curiosity constantly exploring trends, conducting desk research, and scouting for cultural signals and emerging behaviors.
Skilled at translating complex datasets into clear, actionable insights that inform creative thinking and shape brand relevance ‚Äî both for people and algorithms.
Strong communicator who knows how to get to the point ‚Äî making data feel accessible, relevant, and compelling in both written and spoken form.
Proficient in PowerPoint, with the ability to craft presentations that inform, persuade, and guide strategic decisions.
Collaborative and proactive, with a strong sense of ownership and a habit of going beyond task execution to find smarter solutions.
Strong team player with a talent for listening, mediation, and leading teams and clients with clear, substantiated rationales.
Comfortable working across data tools and platforms, with advanced Excel skills (formulas, pivot tables, worksheets).
Fluent in Italian (written and spoken) and fluent in written English ‚Äî good spoken English is a strong plus.
Bonus: experienced in data visualization, presenting insights in elegant, visually engaging formats.
2+ Years of proven experience with data and reporting
Skilled in processing and managing data through Excel and pivot tables
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, combined with strong expertise in data visualization and presentation
Ability to effectively balance high quality with strict deadlines
Your mother tongue is Italian, but you‚Äôre fluent in English
Proficiency with data & analytics platforms (e.g. Brandwatch) is a plus

Joining Dentsu Creative, you will be part of a creative network, delivering ideas that are brought alive in new ways. Along the way, you will team up with inspiring people across the world and become part of a truly inclusive culture where everyone is given the opportunity to thrive and create the best work of their careers
column2: always learning and always listening to shape ideas, create culture and change behaviour. By bringing together the capabilities, experience and relationships of our collective experts, the opportunities for personal growth and development are endless.

column1: We are united by four signature strengths:

Boundless Creativity ‚Äì Kitsune Fox: In Japanese culture ‚Äì the Kitsune Fox sees the future. We run towards the future, forever asking: what‚Äôs next? Our imagination has no limit. Our clients seek us out because we believe there is no problem we cannot solve with the power of modern creativity.

Intelligent Scale - Ryujin Dragon: The Ryujin Dragon controls the ocean and the tides. We flow the right talent around the right brief in the right moment, wherever it sits in the world. We scale our unique ideas with precision, using intelligent technology to make personal connections with millions around the world.

Obsessive Craft - Orizuru Crane: The Orizuru Crane carries the soul up to paradise. It inspires the most classic and iconic Japanese origami. We elevate the soul of our work with an obsessive focus on craft, nurturing the next-gen craft skills needed to soar in a modern world.

Radical Collaboration - Kohaku Koi: The Koi swim upstream against the tide, united as one. We chart new territory through the power of radical collaboration. We seamlessly connect Creativity, Media and CXM to imagine new solutions at the intersection of craft, data, culture, and innovation.

We believe our work can only resonate in the modern world if the people behind it reflect the modern work. We can only be truly relevant when we create a truly inclusive culture where everyone can thrive. That means ‚Äì we are tough on the work but gentle with each other. We lead with empathy and are always listening and always learning. We support each other, we cheer for each other, we win together. We celebrate difference as the only way to make the work that makes a difference.

Dentsu Creative is a global creative agency network designed to unlock exponential growth for clients. We use Transformative Creativity as a differentiating, driving force to bring our capabilities together to positively impact people, business and society.

Established in 2022, Dentsu Creative is integrated with dentsu‚Äôs Media and CXM businesses in over 145 countries and regions, to offer Integrated Growth Solutions.


We are looking for a Data Analyst to be employed in our Milan office.


Role Description


We are looking for Data Analyst with boundless curiosity and a deep passion for data and innovation. Someone who not only sees the numbers, but also understands the people behind them ‚Äî a professional who blends analytical rigor with a humanistic lens on the world.


As a Data Analyst within Dentsu Creative‚Äôs award-winning strategy team, you will dive deep into numbers to decode what‚Äôs really happening around us. With a sharp analytical eye and the ability to see connections beyond the numbers, you read and interpret data to uncover the forces shaping culture, behaviours, and brands ‚Äî turning complex information into clear, strategic insights that inspire bold and impactful thinking and creativity.


You will work closely with all the Dentsu Creative verticals (Brand Strategy, Advertising, Events, Luxury, Gaming, Social, Influencer Marketing, and more) as a true 360¬∫ expert of consumer, industry and cultural trends &
column2:
insights, developing insights and point of views for some of the biggest Global and Italian brands.

From insight reports to sweeping innovation projects, we're looking for someone who‚Äôs curious about the world ‚Äî someone who questions assumptions, challenges conventions, and uses data to reframe challenges and find unexpected answers.


Key Responsibilities


  • Analyze and present reports on digital and social performance, turning data into clear, actionable insights.
  • Conduct social listening analysis to identify conversation patterns, audience and brand insight.
  • Support the design and development of ad hoc surveys to uncover strategic insights and inform brand decision-making.
  • Monitor key trends and shifts, providing analysis that supports teams across dentsu with culturally informed thinking.
  • Help develop analysis packages for clients, supporting the creation of tailored research proposals in collaboration with different Dentsu teams.


Who we are looking for


  • Strategic thinker with a strong analytical mindset and a deep curiosity constantly exploring trends, conducting desk research, and scouting for cultural signals and emerging behaviors.
  • Skilled at translating complex datasets into clear, actionable insights that inform creative thinking and shape brand relevance ‚Äî both for people and algorithms.
  • Strong communicator who knows how to get to the point ‚Äî making data feel accessible, relevant, and compelling in both written and spoken form.
  • Proficient in PowerPoint, with the ability to craft presentations that inform, persuade, and guide strategic decisions.
  • Collaborative and proactive, with a strong sense of ownership and a habit of going beyond task execution to find smarter solutions.
  • Strong team player with a talent for listening, mediation, and leading teams and clients with clear, substantiated rationales.
  • Comfortable working across data tools and platforms, with advanced Excel skills (formulas, pivot tables, worksheets).
  • Fluent in Italian (written and spoken) and fluent in written English ‚Äî good spoken English is a strong plus.
  • Bonus: experienced in data visualization, presenting insights in elegant, visually engaging formats.


Skills &
column3:
Experience


  • 2+ Years of proven experience with data and reporting
  • Skilled in processing and managing data through Excel and pivot tables
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills, combined with strong expertise in data visualization and presentation
  • Obsessive attention to detail
  • Ability to effectively balance high quality with strict deadlines
  • Team working and collaborative attitude
  • Self-motivation and a problem-solving attitude
  • Your mother tongue is Italian, but you‚Äôre fluent in English
  • Proficiency with data &
column4:
analytics platforms (e.g. Brandwatch) is a plus


Working with us


Joining Dentsu Creative, you will be part of a creative network, delivering ideas that are brought alive in new ways. Along the way, you will team up with inspiring people across the world and become part of a truly inclusive culture where everyone is given the opportunity to thrive and create the best work of their careers
column5:
always learning and always listening to shape ideas, create culture and change behaviour. By bringing together the capabilities, experience and relationships of our collective experts, the opportunities for personal growth and development are endless.


We are united by four signature strengths:


Boundless Creativity ‚Äì Kitsune Fox: In Japanese culture ‚Äì the Kitsune Fox sees the future. We run towards the future, forever asking: what‚Äôs next? Our imagination has no limit. Our clients seek us out because we believe there is no problem we cannot solve with the power of modern creativity.


Intelligent Scale - Ryujin Dragon: The Ryujin Dragon controls the ocean and the tides. We flow the right talent around the right brief in the right moment, wherever it sits in the world. We scale our unique ideas with precision, using intelligent technology to make personal connections with millions around the world.


Obsessive Craft - Orizuru Crane: The Orizuru Crane carries the soul up to paradise. It inspires the most classic and iconic Japanese origami. We elevate the soul of our work with an obsessive focus on craft, nurturing the next-gen craft skills needed to soar in a modern world.


Radical Collaboration - Kohaku Koi: The Koi swim upstream against the tide, united as one. We chart new territory through the power of radical collaboration. We seamlessly connect Creativity, Media and CXM to imagine new solutions at the intersection of craft, data, culture, and innovation.


Our Values


We believe our work can only resonate in the modern world if the people behind it reflect the modern work. We can only be truly relevant when we create a truly inclusive culture where everyone can thrive. That means ‚Äì we are tough on the work but gentle with each other. We lead with empathy and are always listening and always learning. We support each other, we cheer for each other, we win together. We celebrate difference as the only way to make the work that makes a difference.

Our household name brands, including Marktplaats in the Netherlands, mobile.de in Germany and leboncoin in France, reach hundreds of millions of people every month.

We‚Äôre all about matchmaking, and our sites help people find whatever they‚Äôre looking for in their local communities ‚Äì whether it‚Äôs a car, an apartment, a sofa or a new job. Every connection made or item found makes a difference by creating a world where people share more and waste less.

Our brands are supported by global Tech Hubs in Barcelona, Amsterdam, Paris and Berlin. Their goal is to develop common global products and innovation platforms which all of our brands can use. This means using cutting edge technology to create highly scalable, customisable and secure products and components that free up development time and leverage our access to global data.
What You‚Äôll Do & Who You Are

We are seeking a Sales Data Analyst with expertise in data analysis to help optimize sales strategies and support our B2B sales team. The ideal candidate will transform platform data into actionable insights to identify business opportunities, improve sales performance, and inform strategic decision-making.
Analyze data from the company‚Äôs digital platform (user traffic, behavior, conversions, etc.) to support the sales team
Identify usage patterns and propose strategies to enhance customer value.
Develop detailed reports and dashboards to monitor sales performance based on platform data
Collaborate with product, marketing, data, and sales teams to align initiatives with insights generated from data analysis
Segment customers and analyze data to support targeted initiatives (e.g., upselling, cross-selling, retention)
Provide sales forecasts using platform data and predictive models
Monitor key performance indicators (e.g., acquisition rate, churn rate) to refine sales strategies
Automate analysis processes to improve efficiency and speed in delivering insights.
Strong ability to communicate complex data insights clearly and effectively to stakeholders
Excellent analytical thinking and attention to detail
Ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams (product, sales, marketing, data)
Adaptability and comfort in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Economics, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Data Science, or a related field
Minimum of 3 years of experience in data analysis, preferably within digital platform or e-commerce environments
Proficiency in data analysis programming languages, preferably Python
Experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI or Tableau
Knowledge of statistical techniques for business-oriented data analysis
Experience with machine learning models for customer segmentation, churn prediction, and sales forecasting
Familiarity with cloud platforms, particularly AWS
Understanding of digital analytics and experience with web analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics)
Opportunity to shape the way we work. Your feedback and opinions are valued at all levels of the organisation
Benefits including stock purchase plan and annual bonus plans
Flexibility to work when and how you want - flexible hours, autonomy to set your own agenda, choice of phone and computer
Smart Working Policy - work remotely some of the time, balanced with time in the office together with your team - between 5 and 45 days per quarter in the office depending on each team.
‚ÄòWork from anywhere‚Äô weeks - up to four weeks working from anywhere, as long as you have an internet connection!
Career development, including language classes and Adevinta Academies: specialised content built by our experts on Machine Learning, Agile, Leadership and more
For each working day, you will be eligible for a ‚Ç¨8 meal voucher. You will receive 250 euros on the welfare platform after the birth of your child

Adevinta is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

If you feel like you don‚Äôt meet all of the requirements for this role but are interested, please consider applying anyway. We strongly encourage people from historically excluded groups to apply and look forward to speaking with you.

What You‚Äôll Do &
column2:
Who You Are

We are seeking a Sales Data Analyst with expertise in data analysis to help optimize sales strategies and support our B2B sales team. The ideal candidate will transform platform data into actionable insights to identify business opportunities, improve sales performance, and inform strategic decision-making.

Key Responsibilities

  • Analyze data from the company‚Äôs digital platform (user traffic, behavior, conversions, etc.) to support the sales team

  • Smart Working Policy - work remotely some of the time, balanced with time in the office together with your team - between 5 and 45 days per quarter in the office depending on each team.
  • ‚ÄòWork from anywhere‚Äô weeks - up to four weeks working from anywhere, as long as you have an internet connection!
  • Career development, including language classes and Adevinta Academies: specialised content built by our experts on Machine Learning, Agile, Leadership and more

For each working day, you will be eligible for a ‚Ç¨8 meal voucher. You will receive 250 euros on the welfare platform after the birth of your child

üîé About the Role

Are you passionate about sustainability, life cycle assessment, and data-driven environmental analysis? Join the ‚ÄúLand Resources and Supply Chain Assessments Unit (D3)‚Äù at the Joint Research Centre (JRC) in Ispra and contribute to shaping EU policy for a sustainable future üåç.

üéØ Key Responsibilities

üß† Your Background

Analisi dati avanzate sul comportamento della clientela sia su canale fisico che digitale attraverso esplorazione di dati strutturati e destrutturati, al fine di derivare insight di business

Hai un‚Äôottima conoscenza di almeno uno tra i linguaggi Python ed R

Hai forti competenze analitiche e ti interessa usare i dati per trovare soluzioni funzionali, creative ed innovative a problemi complessi
Parli e scrivi in inglese fluentemente
Ti interessa lavorare in team e crescere in un ambiente di lavoro stimolante e positivo
Sei flessibile e hai forte motivazione ad intraprendere una carriera professionale in consulenza
Saranno considerate un plus, le conoscenze, anche a livello base di:
Framework Spark e piattaforme Cloud come Amazon Web Services, Azure e Google Cloud Platform

Il tuo talento e la tua curiosit√† avranno tutto lo spazio che meritano e, attraverso l‚Äôidentificazione delle migliori risorse, contribuirai a garantire la qualit√† dei servizi che offriamo ai nostri clienti. Descrizione del ruolo:

Siamo alla ricerca di un/a Transport Data Analyst appassionato/a e preciso/a, che supporti il nostro team logistico attraverso l‚Äôanalisi e l‚Äôinterpretazione dei dati relativi al trasporto. 4236864544,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/insights-and-analytics-internship-all-genders-at-sanofi-4236864544?position=30&pageNum=0&refId=uBpCfe5q2i%2B18hBlyebQZQ%3D%3D&trackingId=pV6jkXKFjJZEiwTZJqPmRg%3D%3D,Insights and Analytics Internship (All Genders),Sanofi,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Insights & Analytics Intern

Vuoi iniziare la tua carriera nel mondo HealthCare? Unisciti a Sanofi e avrai l‚Äôopportunit√† di crescere e sviluppare le tue competenze sotto il coordinamento di stimolanti colleghi, contribuendo a fare la differenza nella vita di migliaia di persone in tutto il mondo. Come tirocinante nel team di Insights & Analytics, sarai coinvolto/a nell'implementazione di nuovi tool analitici su PowerBI, che hanno come obiettivo di monitorare e analizzare la performance (market, adoption, brand) attraverso definiti KPI aziendali. Collaborando con i colleghi di diverse funzioni, accrescerai le tue competenze analitiche e imparerai a lavorare con il metodo KANBAN, famigliarizzando con il mondo farmaceutico e le sue dinamiche e portando attivamente il tuo contributo e le tue idee.

Siamo un'azienda della salute, innovativa e globale, e siamo guidati da uno scopo: sfidare i confini della scienza per migliorare la vita delle persone. Lavorare in Sanofi significa appassionarsi al proprio lavoro, crescere di giorno in giorno esplorando tra innumerevoli opportunit√†, costruire stimolanti relazioni e superare i limiti di ci√≤ che pensavi fosse possibile. Ready to get started?

sarai coinvolto/a in attivit√† di Project Management (PMO) a supporto del Insights & Analytics Pillar Head - Italy
supporterai i team di change management nell'organizzazione e nel coordinamento dei training da erogare ai colleghi e delle comunicazioni in merito all'utilizzo delle piattaforme
ti interfaccerai sia con i team locali sia con i team Global per la gestione e risoluzione delle segnalazioni e problematiche individuate

4267173864,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-with-power-bi-at-txt-group-4267173864?position=34&pageNum=0&refId=uBpCfe5q2i%2B18hBlyebQZQ%3D%3D&trackingId=2GbntqNVZ%2BoKqqzpEdzGfA%3D%3D,Data Analyst with Power BI,TXT GROUP,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","As part of its team expansion, FastCode S.p.A. is looking for a Data Analyst.

We are seeking a professional with at least 1 year of experience in analytics or reporting, even at the beginning of their structured career, who has a good knowledge of Power BI and is eager to grow in the areas of data visualization, reporting, and business analysis.

The selected candidate will join a team dedicated to analyzing company data and building interactive dashboards, with the aim of supporting decision-making processes through reliable analysis and effective visualizations.

The working environment is dynamic, collaborative, and constantly evolving, with continuous training, hands-on support, and opportunities for growth into roles such as data specialist or business analyst.
Create and update interactive dashboards in Power BI
Analyze data from various sources (databases, Excel files, business systems)
Collaborate with business teams to understand reporting needs and KPI measurement
Turn raw data into clear, decision-oriented visualizations
Ensure quality, consistency, and timely updates of datasets
Document analysis processes and calculation criteria
Solid command of Power BI, including Power Query, DAX, and cloud publishing
Excellent knowledge of Excel (formulas, pivot tables, charts)
Ability to process and transform datasets for analytical purposes
Understanding of key performance indicators (KPIs) and performance metrics
Experience with ETL tools or pipelines (e.g., Azure Data Factory, Talend, SSIS)
Basic knowledge of Python for data analysis (e.g., Pandas, NumPy)
Familiarity with other business intelligence tools (e.g., Tableau, Qlik)
Experience in finance, retail, or industrial sectors
Knowledge of relational databases (e.g., SQL Server, PostgreSQL)
Curiosity, observational skills, and interest in analysis
Ability to communicate effectively and make data understandable
Precision, attention to detail, and quality orientation
Proactivity and motivation for professional growth
Inclusion in an environment that values skills and professional growth
Mentorship, on-the-job training, and development of analytical capabilities
Opportunities to evolve into specialist or strategic roles
Contract and compensation based on experience
The chance to work in a fast-growing, constantly evolving company
Hybrid work model (1 day remote, 4 days onsite)

FastCode S.p.A. actively promotes an inclusive work environment that respects differences. Applications are open to all individuals, regardless of gender, in accordance with Legislative Decree 198/2006. We believe that valuing diversity and ensuring equal opportunities are key drivers of innovation and organizational well-being.

As part of its team expansion, FastCode S.p.A. is looking for a Data Analyst.

We are seeking a professional with at least 1 year of experience in analytics or reporting, even at the beginning of their structured career, who has a good knowledge of Power BI and is eager to grow in the areas of data visualization, reporting, and business analysis.

The selected candidate will join a team dedicated to analyzing company data and building interactive dashboards, with the aim of supporting decision-making processes through reliable analysis and effective visualizations.

The working environment is dynamic, collaborative, and constantly evolving, with continuous training, hands-on support, and opportunities for growth into roles such as data specialist or business analyst.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Create and update interactive dashboards in Power BI
  • Analyze data from various sources (databases, Excel files, business systems)
  • Collaborate with business teams to understand reporting needs and KPI measurement
  • Turn raw data into clear, decision-oriented visualizations
  • Ensure quality, consistency, and timely updates of datasets
  • Document analysis processes and calculation criteria


Required Technical Skills:

  • Solid command of Power BI, including Power Query, DAX, and cloud publishing
  • Knowledge of SQL (basic/intermediate level)
  • Excellent knowledge of Excel (formulas, pivot tables, charts)
  • Ability to process and transform datasets for analytical purposes
  • Understanding of key performance indicators (KPIs) and performance metrics


Preferred Technical Skills:

  • Experience with ETL tools or pipelines (e.g., Azure Data Factory, Talend, SSIS)
  • Basic knowledge of Python for data analysis (e.g., Pandas, NumPy)
  • Familiarity with other business intelligence tools (e.g., Tableau, Qlik)
  • Experience in finance, retail, or industrial sectors
  • Knowledge of relational databases (e.g., SQL Server, PostgreSQL)


Soft Skills Required:

  • Curiosity, observational skills, and interest in analysis
  • Ability to communicate effectively and make data understandable
  • Precision, attention to detail, and quality orientation
  • Proactivity and motivation for professional growth
  • Teamwork and cross-functional collaboration skills


What We Offer:

  • Inclusion in an environment that values skills and professional growth
  • Mentorship, on-the-job training, and development of analytical capabilities
  • Opportunities to evolve into specialist or strategic roles
  • Contract and compensation based on experience


Why Choose FastCode:

  • The chance to work in a fast-growing, constantly evolving company
  • A young, international team environment
  • Training aligned with job-related activities
  • Corporate benefits (Health Insurance, Meal Vouchers)
  • Hybrid work model (1 day remote, 4 days onsite)


FastCode S.p.A. actively promotes an inclusive work environment that respects differences. Applications are open to all individuals, regardless of gender, in accordance with Legislative Decree 198/2006. We believe that valuing diversity and ensuring equal opportunities are key drivers of innovation and organizational well-being.

Publicis Groupe

4267734086,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-bending-spoons-4267734086?position=39&pageNum=0&refId=uBpCfe5q2i%2B18hBlyebQZQ%3D%3D&trackingId=wX8%2BTFO%2BHW2VWn9MPeta%2Bw%3D%3D,Data Analyst,Bending Spoons,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","At Bending Spoons, we‚Äôre striving to build one of the all-time great companies. A company that serves a huge number of customers. A company where team members grow to their full potential. A company that functions at unparalleled levels of effectiveness and efficiency. A company that creates value for shareowners at an extraordinary rate. And a company that does so while adhering to high ethical standards.

To achieve this objective, we execute the following strategy: We acquire a digital business with untapped potential and make it as successful as we can by leveraging our platform‚Äîwhich comprises our expertise, technologies, data, brand, talents, and company culture. Then, we invest the proceeds into making our platform more powerful, and into acquiring new businesses. Thus, our strategy sees us combine an investor‚Äôs attention to capital allocation with the hands-on approach of an operator.

For a talented, driven, and collaborative individual, working at Bending Spoons is an opportunity to learn, make an impact, and progress their career at an exceptionally high rate. That‚Äôs our promise to such a candidate.
A few examples of your responsibilities
Collaborate with Product and Business teams to determine the most pressing questions that big data can help answer, and then figure out how to uncover those insights.
Query and analyze massive sets of usage data to identify product-improvement opportunities and actionable insights to profoundly impact our product strategy and roadmap.
Create brief, high-quality reports to explain your findings and discuss their implications with the relevant team members.
Screen the app stores and study competing products in search of insights and ideas we could learn from.
Help direct the development of our technologies devoted to the acquisition, storage, and manipulation of big data, supporting our efforts to constantly break new ground in this field.

Reasoning ability. Given the necessary knowledge, you can solve complex problems. You think from first principles, and structure your ideas sharply. You resist the influence of biases. You identify and take care of the details that matter.

Drive. You‚Äôre extremely ambitious in everything you do‚Äîand your initiative, effort, and tenacity match the intensity of your ambition. You feel deeply responsible for your work. You hold yourself to a high‚Äîand rising‚Äîbar.

Team spirit. You give generously and without the expectation of receiving in return. You support the best idea, not your idea. You're always happy to get your hands dirty to help your team. You‚Äôre reliable, honest, and transparent.
Proficiency in English. You read, write, and speak proficiently in English.
Incredibly talented, entrepreneurial teams. You‚Äôll work in small, result-oriented, autonomous teams alongside some of the brightest people in your field.

An exceptional opportunity for growth. We go to great lengths to hire individuals of outstanding potential‚Äîthen, our priority is to put them in the ideal position to thrive. Spooners in their 20s lead products worth hundreds of millions of dollars. And if you‚Äôve got what it takes, you‚Äôll soon be playing an essential role in major projects, too.

Competitive pay and access to equity in the company. Typically, we offer an individual at the start of their career a salary of ¬£66,779 in the UK and ‚Ç¨63,965 elsewhere. If they possess a few years of relevant experience, the salary on offer tends to be between ¬£110,389 and ¬£149,636 in the UK, and ‚Ç¨105,737 and ‚Ç¨143,330 elsewhere. Pay grows rapidly as you accumulate experience and translate it into greater impact. You can also receive some of your pay in company equity at a discounted price, thus participating in the value creation we achieve together. If relocating to Italy, you may enjoy a 50% tax cut.

All. These. Benefits. Flexible hours, remote working, unlimited backing for learning and training, top-of-the-market health insurance, a rich relocation package, generous parental support, and a yearly retreat to a stunning location. We help each Spooner set up the conditions to do their best work.
Permanent or fixed-term. Full-time or part-time.

Bending Spoons is a demanding environment: We're extremely ambitious and we ask a lot of ourselves and one another. While this tends to lead to fantastic learning, achievements, and career growth, it also requires a significant commitment. So if you like the role and are ready to give your very best, don't hesitate to apply.
If you pass our screening, we‚Äôll ask you to take on a few tests that assess how you approach unfamiliar problems. If you‚Äôre successful with those, we‚Äôll invite you to a series of interviews.

Bending Spoons is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We consider for employment any applicant and we provide reasonable accommodations for an applicant with disabilities, which can be requested through this form.

Studies suggest that women tend not to apply for a job if their CV isn‚Äôt a perfect fit. Here, talent takes precedence over experience. So if you like the role and think you could be awesome at it in time, go ahead and apply.

At Bending Spoons, we‚Äôre striving to build one of the all-time great companies. A company that serves a huge number of customers. A company where team members grow to their full potential. A company that functions at unparalleled levels of effectiveness and efficiency. A company that creates value for shareowners at an extraordinary rate. And a company that does so while adhering to high ethical standards.

To achieve this objective, we execute the following strategy: We acquire a digital business with untapped potential and make it as successful as we can by leveraging our platform‚Äîwhich comprises our expertise, technologies, data, brand, talents, and company culture. Then, we invest the proceeds into making our platform more powerful, and into acquiring new businesses. Thus, our strategy sees us combine an investor‚Äôs attention to capital allocation with the hands-on approach of an operator.

For a talented, driven, and collaborative individual, working at Bending Spoons is an opportunity to learn, make an impact, and progress their career at an exceptionally high rate. That‚Äôs our promise to such a candidate.

A few examples of your responsibilities
  • Collaborate with Product and Business teams to determine the most pressing questions that big data can help answer, and then figure out how to uncover those insights.
  • Query and analyze massive sets of usage data to identify product-improvement opportunities and actionable insights to profoundly impact our product strategy and roadmap.
  • Create brief, high-quality reports to explain your findings and discuss their implications with the relevant team members.

  • Help direct the development of our technologies devoted to the acquisition, storage, and manipulation of big data, supporting our efforts to constantly break new ground in this field.

What we look for
  • Reasoning ability. Given the necessary knowledge, you can solve complex problems. You think from first principles, and structure your ideas sharply. You resist the influence of biases. You identify and take care of the details that matter.
  • Drive. You‚Äôre extremely ambitious in everything you do‚Äîand your initiative, effort, and tenacity match the intensity of your ambition. You feel deeply responsible for your work. You hold yourself to a high‚Äîand rising‚Äîbar.
  • Team spirit. You give generously and without the expectation of receiving in return. You support the best idea, not your idea. You're always happy to get your hands dirty to help your team. You‚Äôre reliable, honest, and transparent.
  • Proficiency in English. You read, write, and speak proficiently in English.

What we offer
  • Incredibly talented, entrepreneurial teams. You‚Äôll work in small, result-oriented, autonomous teams alongside some of the brightest people in your field.
  • An exceptional opportunity for growth. We go to great lengths to hire individuals of outstanding potential‚Äîthen, our priority is to put them in the ideal position to thrive. Spooners in their 20s lead products worth hundreds of millions of dollars. And if you‚Äôve got what it takes, you‚Äôll soon be playing an essential role in major projects, too.
  • Competitive pay and access to equity in the company. Typically, we offer an individual at the start of their career a salary of ¬£66,779 in the UK and ‚Ç¨63,965 elsewhere. If they possess a few years of relevant experience, the salary on offer tends to be between ¬£110,389 and ¬£149,636 in the UK, and ‚Ç¨105,737 and ‚Ç¨143,330 elsewhere. Pay grows rapidly as you accumulate experience and translate it into greater impact. You can also receive some of your pay in company equity at a discounted price, thus participating in the value creation we achieve together. If relocating to Italy, you may enjoy a 50% tax cut.
  • All. These. Benefits. Flexible hours, remote working, unlimited backing for learning and training, top-of-the-market health insurance, a rich relocation package, generous parental support, and a yearly retreat to a stunning location. We help each Spooner set up the conditions to do their best work.

Commitment &
column2:
contract
Permanent or fixed-term. Full-time or part-time.

Location
Milan (Italy), London (UK).

Before you apply
Bending Spoons is a demanding environment: We're extremely ambitious and we ask a lot of ourselves and one another. While this tends to lead to fantastic learning, achievements, and career growth, it also requires a significant commitment. So if you like the role and are ready to give your very best, don't hesitate to apply.

The selection process
If you pass our screening, we‚Äôll ask you to take on a few tests that assess how you approach unfamiliar problems. If you‚Äôre successful with those, we‚Äôll invite you to a series of interviews.

Bending Spoons is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We consider for employment any applicant and we provide reasonable accommodations for an applicant with disabilities, which can be requested through this form.

Studies suggest that women tend not to apply for a job if their CV isn‚Äôt a perfect fit. Here, talent takes precedence over experience. So if you like the role and think you could be awesome at it in time, go ahead and apply.

We want to innovate the financial services offered by commercial/retail banks in Italy in the areas of wealth management, credit lending, risk management and compliance. Building on our consolidated expertise and product offering in the Capital Markets domain, we want to scale our solutions and frameworks to the commercial/retail banking industry. To do so, we start from the quantitative modelling and analysis of the current processes put in place by our customers, so that we can profile opportunities of automation and prioritize client needs on manual/painful workflows. The resource will be involved in business process analyses of Italian commercial/retail financial institutions and is expected to integrate structured information extracted from interviews with the analysis of literature and documentation to build a quantitative picture of the AS-IS. The analysis will then be complemented with a consequent implementation analysis and product roadmap definition to design the TO-BE and drive product evolutions and developments. The project entails modelling complex business contexts, extracting structured information from unstructured sources, performing quantitative analyses, presenting findings and recommendations to external clients and internal stakeholders, contributing to the definition of product backlogs.
What You Will Learn During Your Intern
Codification of customer requirements, needs, activities
Business intelligence with PowerBI/Excel - Packaging high-quality deliverables for external clients ‚Äì
Data manipulation with Pandas or Spark/Hive
Hands-on experience with BI tools (Excel, PowerBI)
Experience with Python data science libraries (pandas, pyspark, sklearn) is nice to have
We Are Looking For Someone Who
is passionate about modelling unknown business contexts with a quantitative approach
can find a good trade-off between quality and speed of delivery
proactively contribute your insights and ideas in a way that fits existing frameworks of the firm
is fond of sharing knowledge with colleagues and documenting your work

At ION

We want to innovate the financial services offered by commercial/retail banks in Italy in the areas of wealth management, credit lending, risk management and compliance. Building on our consolidated expertise and product offering in the Capital Markets domain, we want to scale our solutions and frameworks to the commercial/retail banking industry. To do so, we start from the quantitative modelling and analysis of the current processes put in place by our customers, so that we can profile opportunities of automation and prioritize client needs on manual/painful workflows. The resource will be involved in business process analyses of Italian commercial/retail financial institutions and is expected to integrate structured information extracted from interviews with the analysis of literature and documentation to build a quantitative picture of the AS-IS. The analysis will then be complemented with a consequent implementation analysis and product roadmap definition to design the TO-BE and drive product evolutions and developments. The project entails modelling complex business contexts, extracting structured information from unstructured sources, performing quantitative analyses, presenting findings and recommendations to external clients and internal stakeholders, contributing to the definition of product backlogs.

What You Will Learn During Your Intern

  • Quantitative modelling of business processes
  • Codification of customer requirements, needs, activities
  • Business intelligence with PowerBI/Excel - Packaging high-quality deliverables for external clients ‚Äì
  • Data manipulation with Pandas or Spark/Hive

What You Need To Know

  • Hands-on experience with BI tools (Excel, PowerBI)
  • Experience with Python data science libraries (pandas, pyspark, sklearn) is nice to have
  • Fluent English

We Are Looking For Someone Who

  • is passionate about modelling unknown business contexts with a quantitative approach
  • can find a good trade-off between quality and speed of delivery
  • proactively contribute your insights and ideas in a way that fits existing frameworks of the firm
  • is fond of sharing knowledge with colleagues and documenting your work

4265237859,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-marketing-growth-italy-they-she-he-at-glovo-4265237859?position=41&pageNum=0&refId=uBpCfe5q2i%2B18hBlyebQZQ%3D%3D&trackingId=3miN%2FjrGOeV4SKRdg8DDdg%3D%3D,Data Analyst Marketing & Growth - Italy (They/She/He),Glovo,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","If you‚Äôre here, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre looking for an exciting ride.
A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.
We‚Äôll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 23 countries.

Together we revolutionise the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.
ü§ù Our commitment to being a force for good.
We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.
Understand business needs and create insightful analysis helping your team to make the right decisions to boost Glovo presence and orders

Identify growth opportunities to increase our user base focusing on traffic, conversion and retention rates and leveraging on levers such as pricing, promotions, events, CRM and other marketing levers etc
Drive projects end-to-end translating business challenges into insights and actions
Identify growth opportunities to increase our user base, step change retention rates and maximize profitability
Take ownership of the reporting of KPIs by creating customized tools and using the available ones
Ensure these tools are scalable and up-to-date
Assist your colleagues in gaining access to the right data, and communicate and simplify concepts to the audience's needs
Drive clarity and solve ambiguity using data-driven approaches

Apply your expertise in quantitative analysis, data mining, and the presentation of data to see beyond the numbers and understand how our users interact with both our consumer and business products, identify growth opportunities, and execute projects to drive growth and engagement
What You Will Bring To The Ride
1-3 years of work experience on analytical roles leading analysis and turning insights into actions
Bachelor's degree in Math, Engineering, Business, Stats, Quantitative field or Business
SQL proficiency is mandatory / Python is a plus
Ninja expertise with Excel / Google Sheets is a must
Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau and Looker
Business acumen and passion for end-to-end project management (from ideation and analysis into implementation)
A hands-on attitude is a must. You‚Äôll have to roll up your sleeves!

Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.
üí™ Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.

Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.
Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).
So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?
Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We‚Äôll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 23 countries.

Together we revolutionise the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

YOUR MISSION

  • Understand business needs and create insightful analysis helping your team to make the right decisions to boost Glovo presence and orders
  • Identify growth opportunities to increase our user base focusing on traffic, conversion and retention rates and leveraging on levers such as pricing, promotions, events, CRM and other marketing levers etc
  • Drive projects end-to-end translating business challenges into insights and actions
  • Identify growth opportunities to increase our user base, step change retention rates and maximize profitability

  • Ensure these tools are scalable and up-to-date

What You Will Bring To The Ride

  • 1-3 years of work experience on analytical roles leading analysis and turning insights into actions
  • Bachelor's degree in Math, Engineering, Business, Stats, Quantitative field or Business
  • SQL proficiency is mandatory / Python is a plus
  • Ninja expertise with Excel / Google Sheets is a must
  • Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau and Looker
  • Business acumen and passion for end-to-end project management (from ideation and analysis into implementation)
  • A hands-on attitude is a must. You‚Äôll have to roll up your sleeves!
  • Proficiency in English
  • Strong consumer understanding skills

Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves

  • üí™ Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
  • üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
  • üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
  • üë™ Enhanced parental leave.
  • üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.

Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

4236190640,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/junior-capabilities-insight-analyst-at-mckinsey-company-4236190640?position=45&pageNum=0&refId=uBpCfe5q2i%2B18hBlyebQZQ%3D%3D&trackingId=hActBC5w%2FCrnjTTqn7fs8w%3D%3D,Junior Capabilities & Insight Analyst,McKinsey & Company,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Who You'll Work With

Driving lasting impact and building long-term capabilities with our clients is not easy work. You are the kind of person who thrives in a high performance/high reward culture - doing hard things, picking yourself up when you stumble, and having the resilience to try another way forward.

In return for your drive, determination, and curiosity, we'll provide the resources, mentorship, and opportunities you need to become a stronger leader faster than you ever thought possible. Your colleagues‚Äîat all levels‚Äîwill invest deeply in your development, just as much as they invest in delivering exceptional results for clients. Every day, you'll receive apprenticeship, coaching, and exposure that will accelerate your growth in ways you won‚Äôt find anywhere else.
When you join us, you will have:

Continuous learning: Our learning and apprenticeship culture, backed by structured programs, is all about helping you grow while creating an environment where feedback is clear, actionable, and focused on your development. The real magic happens when you take the input from others to heart and embrace the fast-paced learning experience, owning your journey.

A voice that matters: From day one, we value your ideas and contributions. You‚Äôll make a tangible impact by offering innovative ideas and practical solutions. We not only encourage diverse perspectives, but they are critical in driving us toward the best possible outcomes.

Global community: With colleagues across 65+ countries and over 100 different nationalities, our firm‚Äôs diversity fuels creativity and helps us come up with the best solutions for our clients. Plus, you‚Äôll have the opportunity to learn from exceptional colleagues with diverse backgrounds and experiences.

World-class benefits: On top of a competitive salary (based on your location, experience, and skills), we provide a comprehensive benefits package to enable holistic well-being for you and your family.

You will support consultants and clients developing capabilities to gain insights to solve specific client business problems and will leverage your experience in research to be a thought-partner to teams and clients.

In this role, you will prioritize research activities to make a change that matters. You will develop with time industry knowledge and expertise in various sectors and business functions. You‚Äôll also collaborate with our global research team to share and build knowledge, best practices and relevant new ideas. You will develop knowledge and help support the continuous improvement of our knowledge assets, innovating firm knowledge and delivery through special projects, both with client teams and on a stand-alone basis.

You will be based in our Milan office as part of Milan Client Capability Network team.

The Milan Client Capabilities Network is part of the geographic research and knowledge group with analysts covering the main sectors of activity for McKinsey in Italy. The Client Capabilities Network is a global network, which includes more than 7000 research and knowledge professionals who work alongside our consultants and clients to generate distinctive insights and proprietary knowledge.

When you join McKinsey, you will be part of global community of colleagues with diverse backgrounds and expertise who are all working to create positive, sustainable and inclusive growth. We will accelerate your development as a leader to create positive, enduring change in the world.

Consumer & Marketing Insights Data Analyst Intern

Siamo alla ricerca di una risorsa da inserire come CMI Data Analyst intern da inserire nella funzione Consumer and Market Insights nella nostra Business Unit Home & Personale Care, divisione Home Care, con sede a Milano.

La tua capacit√† di analizzare e interpretare dati complessi provenienti da diverse fonti sar√† essenziale per fornire insights strategici che aiuteranno i team di Marketing, Trade Marketing e Sales a prendere decisioni informate. Contribuirai a migliorare la comprensione delle dinamiche di mercato e del comportamento dei consumatori, giocando un ruolo cruciale nell'identificazione di opportunit√† di crescita e nell'ottimizzazione delle strategie commerciali. La tua attenzione ai dettagli e la tua abilit√† nel tradurre i dati in presentazioni chiare ed efficaci ti permetteranno di facilitare la comunicazione interna e influenzare positivamente le decisioni aziendali.

Sarai responsabile dell'analisi quotidiana dei dati di vendita al dettaglio e dei consumatori, estraendo informazioni chiave da fonti come Nielsen, GfK o Euromonitor. Questi insights ti aiuteranno a generare report che faciliteranno decisioni strategiche per i team interni.

Creerai presentazioni in PowerPoint per comunicare i risultati delle tue analisi ai team di Marketing, Trade Marketing e Sales, garantendo che le informazioni siano trasmesse in modo chiaro ed efficace.

Fornirai supporto operativo ai team rispondendo a specifiche domande di business attraverso l'estrazione e l'analisi dei dati, oltre ad assistere con compiti amministrativi come gli ordini di acquisto.
Riporterai direttamente al Consumer and Market Insights Manager nella divisione Home Care.
Che Cosa Ti Rende Un Buon Fit
Hai una laurea specialistica, o triennale seguita da un master, in Economia, Statistica, Management
Hai un‚Äôottima conoscenza della lingua inglese
Hai un‚Äôottima conoscenza del pacchetto Office e di Excel e buone doti analitiche
Proattivit√†, autonomia, forte orientamento al risultato e capacit√† di lavorare in un contesto dinamico sono soft skills che ti contraddistinguono
Hai eccellenti capacit√† comunicative e relazionali
Sede di Lavoro: Milano, Via Pirelli
Orario di lavoro: Full Time con opzione smart working
Curioso di conoscerci? Scopri di pi√π:

Bolton √® un'azienda italiana a conduzione familiare, specializzata nel settore dei beni di consumo, che conta 10.500 dipendenti distribuiti in 60 uffici, 17 stabilimenti produttivi, 10 laboratori di ricerca e sviluppo e 14 pescherecci in tutto il mondo. Con un portafoglio diversificato di oltre 60 marchi di qualit√†, Bolton ha arricchito la vita di milioni di persone ogni giorno per pi√π di 75 anni, rendendo la loro quotidianit√† pi√π deliziosa, pi√π piacevole, utile e bella.

Bolton Home & Personal Care ha una missione unica: aiutare le persone a prendersi cura delle loro case e dei loro corpi. Attraverso marchi noti e amati da milioni di persone, come Winni‚Äôs e Chilly, Bolton rende la vita quotidiana pi√π piacevole, pulita, fresca e bella. La Business Unit √® pienamente impegnata nello sviluppo sostenibile con particolare attenzione alla circolarit√† e all'approvvigionamento delle materie prime.
We are looking for a CMI Data Analyst intern to join the Consumer and Market Insights function within our Home & Personal Care Business Unit, Home Care division, based in Milan.

Your ability to analyze and interpret complex data from various sources will be essential in providing strategic insights that will help the Marketing, Trade Marketing, and Sales teams make informed decisions. You will contribute to improving the understanding of market dynamics and consumer behavior, playing a crucial role in identifying growth opportunities and optimizing business strategies. Your attention to detail and skill in translating data into clear and effective presentations will enable you to facilitate internal communication and positively influence business decisions.

You will be responsible for the daily analysis of retail sales and consumer data, extracting key insights from sources such as Nielsen, GfK, or Euromonitor. These insights will help you generate reports that facilitate strategic decisions for internal teams.
You will create PowerPoint presentations to communicate the results of your analyses to the Marketing, Trade Marketing, and Sales teams, ensuring that information is conveyed clearly and effectively.

You will provide operational support to the teams by answering specific business questions through data extraction and analysis, as well as assisting with administrative tasks such as purchase orders.
You will report directly to the Consumer and Market Insights Manager in the Home Care division.
What Makes You a Great Fit
You have a master's degree or a bachelor's degree followed by a master's in Economics, Statistics, or Management.
You have an excellent command of the English language.
You have strong knowledge of the Office suite and Excel, along with good analytical skills.
Proactivity, autonomy, a strong results orientation, and the ability to work in a dynamic environment are your distinguishing soft skills.
You possess excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Remote Working: Standard business hours with remote working options available

Bolton is an Italian family-owned fast-moving consumer goods company with 10.500 people located across 60 offices, 17 production facilities, 10 R&D laboratories, and 14 fishing vessels worldwide. With a diverse portfolio of over 60 quality brands, Bolton has been enriching the lives of millions of people every day for more than 75 years, making their everyday more delicious, more enjoyable, useful, and beautiful.

Bolton Home & Personal Care is a Business Unit of Bolton with a single mission: help people take care of their homes and bodies. Through well-known brands that are loved by millions, such as Winni's and Chilly, they make everyday lives more enjoyable, cleaner, fresher and more beautiful. The Business Unit is fully committed to sustainable development with a particular focus on circularity and sourcing raw materials.
