4265987017,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/information-technology-support-specialist-at-avaso-technology-solutions-4265987017?position=2&pageNum=2&refId=sYtKpF0XoYcTuh1clzt11Q%3D%3D&trackingId=g3Nw5LRg%2FQzRtLuhczsRYQ%3D%3D,Information Technology Support Specialist,AVASO Technology Solutions,"Zurich, Zurich, Switzerland","Job Opportunity: Onsite Support Engineer at AVASO Technology

AVASO Technology is a global leader in providing IT solutions and services, specializing in offering top-tier support and managed services. We are committed to delivering cutting-edge technology solutions to our clients worldwide. If you‚Äôre a passionate IT professional with hands-on experience in desktop support, join us at AVASO to help businesses thrive with reliable and efficient IT services.

We are seeking an experienced Onsite Support Engineer to join our team in Location: Zurich, Switzerland . The successful candidate will provide technical support, troubleshooting, and IT assistance to end users. This role requires someone with strong technical skills and a customer-focused approach.
Provide on-site and remote desktop support for users, ensuring issues are resolved quickly and efficiently.
Troubleshoot and resolve hardware, software, and network-related issues.
Install, configure, and maintain desktop systems, laptops, and peripherals.
Ensure the deployment of operating systems, updates, and software packages.
Work with the IT team to resolve and escalate issues as needed.
Perform routine system audits and ensure systems are up-to-date and secure.
Provide end-user training and technical documentation where necessary.
Collaborate with team members and manage support tickets for various internal stakeholders.
2+ years of experience in Desktop Support or similar roles.
Strong experience with Windows OS, Mac OS, and Linux environments.
Experience with Active Directory for user management, group policies, and security.
Proficient with remote desktop tools and troubleshooting techniques.
Experience with networking protocols (TCP/IP, DNS, DHCP).
Strong knowledge of MS Office Suite and other productivity software.
Expertise in hardware diagnostics, repair, and replacements.
Knowledge of system imaging and software deployment tools (e.g., SCCM, MDT).
Familiar with ITIL processes for incident, problem, and change management.
Strong communication skills, with the ability to explain technical issues to non-technical users.
Ability to work independently, manage priorities, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
Certification: CompTIA A+, Microsoft Certified Desktop Support Technician (MCDST), or equivalent.
Experience with cloud-based applications (e.g., Microsoft 365, Google Workspace).
Knowledge of IT security best practices and protocols.
Join a dynamic and innovative team with a global presence.
Opportunities for career growth and continuous learning.
Work with cutting-edge technologies to shape the future of IT solutions.
Ready to take your career to the next level? Apply now by clicking the ""Easy Apply"" button or send your resume to Neha1@Avasotech.com

AVASO Technology Solutions (referred as ‚ÄúAvaso‚Äù) do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment on the basis of race, color, sex, creed, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, gender identity, pregnancy, genetic information, disability, protected veteran status, or any other status protected by state or local law, and to provide equal employment opportunity. Job Opportunity: Onsite Support Engineer at AVASO Technology

Location: Zurich, Switzerland

Employment Type: Dispatch

Experience: 2+ years

Language Known: English

Company Overview:

AVASO Technology is a global leader in providing IT solutions and services, specializing in offering top-tier support and managed services. We are committed to delivering cutting-edge technology solutions to our clients worldwide. If you‚Äôre a passionate IT professional with hands-on experience in desktop support, join us at AVASO to help businesses thrive with reliable and efficient IT services.

Position Overview:

We are seeking an experienced Onsite Support Engineer to join our team in Location: Zurich, Switzerland . The successful candidate will provide technical support, troubleshooting, and IT assistance to end users. This role requires someone with strong technical skills and a customer-focused approach.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Provide on-site and remote desktop support for users, ensuring issues are resolved quickly and efficiently.
  • Troubleshoot and resolve hardware, software, and network-related issues.
  • Install, configure, and maintain desktop systems, laptops, and peripherals.
  • Ensure the deployment of operating systems, updates, and software packages.
  • Work with the IT team to resolve and escalate issues as needed.
  • Perform routine system audits and ensure systems are up-to-date and secure.
  • Provide end-user training and technical documentation where necessary.
  • Collaborate with team members and manage support tickets for various internal stakeholders.

Required Skills &
column2:
Qualifications:

  • 2+ years of experience in Desktop Support or similar roles.
  • Strong experience with Windows OS, Mac OS, and Linux environments.
  • Experience with Active Directory for user management, group policies, and security.
  • Proficient with remote desktop tools and troubleshooting techniques.
  • Experience with networking protocols (TCP/IP, DNS, DHCP).
  • Strong knowledge of MS Office Suite and other productivity software.
  • Expertise in hardware diagnostics, repair, and replacements.
  • Knowledge of system imaging and software deployment tools (e.g., SCCM, MDT).
  • Familiar with ITIL processes for incident, problem, and change management.
  • Strong communication skills, with the ability to explain technical issues to non-technical users.
  • Ability to work independently, manage priorities, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
  • Fluency in English.

Must Have Skills:

  • Certification: CompTIA A+, Microsoft Certified Desktop Support Technician (MCDST), or equivalent.
  • Experience with cloud-based applications (e.g., Microsoft 365, Google Workspace).
  • Knowledge of IT security best practices and protocols.

Why AVASO Technology?

  • Join a dynamic and innovative team with a global presence.
  • Opportunities for career growth and continuous learning.
  • Competitive salary and benefits package.
  • Work with cutting-edge technologies to shape the future of IT solutions.

4265429111,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/senior-data-engineer-at-nicoll-curtin-4265429111?position=3&pageNum=2&refId=sYtKpF0XoYcTuh1clzt11Q%3D%3D&trackingId=tLo72bmp0gtX6qglnAK5qg%3D%3D,Senior Data Engineer,Nicoll Curtin,"Zurich, Switzerland","We are looking for a Senior Data Engineer to join our client in Zurich who is one of the leaders in the financial industry.
This is a contracting role, with the initial duration of 12 months.
In this position, you will collaborate with data engineers and solution architects and focus on the development of robust data pipelines in PySpark on Databricks.

If you have a degree in computer science or related field, strong software engineering skills, strong experience with Python, PySpark, Spark, Delta Lake, Databricks and Azure, and fluency in English, this opportunity is the perfect fit for you!
If you are interested in this role, apply directly to bojana.bandovic@nicollcurtin.com.

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world‚Äôs largest brands.



Qualification Path


No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.


Basic Requirements

  • Full Professional Proficiency in English &
column2:
German language
  • Being a resident in Switzerland for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Switzerland
  • Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
  • Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
  • Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software


    • Assessment

    In order to be hired into the program, you‚Äôll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.


    Equal Opportunity

    All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants‚Äô qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

4264464356,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/ai-engineer-computer-vision-at-flexion-robotics-4264464356?position=8&pageNum=2&refId=sYtKpF0XoYcTuh1clzt11Q%3D%3D&trackingId=%2FIWhSClIff1cEh0GKI2Cwg%3D%3D,AI Engineer - Computer Vision,Flexion Robotics,"Zurich, Zurich, Switzerland","We are looking for a machine learning & computer vision expert to strengthen our team in Zurich.
The goal of this position is to develop and fine-tune state of the art vision and 3D geometric models for scene segmentation and scene understanding.
Experience with developing and training state of the art (transformer-based) vision models. Experience with 3D models to operate on point clouds is a plus.
PhD or master's degree in computer vision or machine learning with relevant project experience (e.g. master thesis)
Excellent knowledge of Python, PyTorch and the training of deep neural networks
Hands-on experience in the training and deployment of 2D and 3D segmentation and environment understanding models
We are looking for a person who enjoys working in a team in a very dynamic and fast-moving environment, and who is able and willing to take ownership of projects and decisions.
We at Flexion Robotics (flexion.ai) are a young company in Zurich working on the next generation of humanoid robot software to enable robots to perform useful tasks autonomously.
We work dynamically and move fast. The team is still fairly small and every new employee at this stage will have significant ownership of their current project.
We offer a competitive remuneration in the form of a competitive base salary and additional components/benefits depending on the specific role and the experience of the applicant.
We are looking for a machine learning &amp
column2:
computer vision expert to strengthen our team in Zurich.

The goal of this position is to develop and fine-tune state of the art vision and 3D geometric models for scene segmentation and scene understanding.

Requirements

Experience with developing and training state of the art (transformer-based) vision models. Experience with 3D models to operate on point clouds is a plus.

Particularly:

  • PhD or master's degree in computer vision or machine learning with relevant project experience (e.g. master thesis)
  • Excellent knowledge of Python, PyTorch and the training of deep neural networks
  • Hands-on experience in the training and deployment of 2D and 3D segmentation and environment understanding models
  • Robotics experience is a plus.

We are looking for a person who enjoys working in a team in a very dynamic and fast-moving environment, and who is able and willing to take ownership of projects and decisions.

Benefits

We at Flexion Robotics (flexion.ai) are a young company in Zurich working on the next generation of humanoid robot software to enable robots to perform useful tasks autonomously.

We work dynamically and move fast. The team is still fairly small and every new employee at this stage will have significant ownership of their current project.

We offer a competitive remuneration in the form of a competitive base salary and additional components/benefits depending on the specific role and the experience of the applicant.

4266724178,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/gis-remote-sensing-specialist-for-hq-or-global-based-in-geneva-link-for-external-applicants-at-impact-initiatives-4266724178?position=9&pageNum=2&refId=sYtKpF0XoYcTuh1clzt11Q%3D%3D&trackingId=f2MQYcYnD12Ep7jV7UJ9KQ%3D%3D,"GIS & Remote Sensing Specialist for HQ or Global, based in Geneva (Link For External Applicants)",IMPACT Initiatives,"Vernier, Geneva, Switzerland","Overview

The global GIS and Remote Sensing team at IMPACT plays a critical role in achieving the organisation‚Äôs research and analysis objectives, by enabling the production of timely, nuanced, evidence-based insights that can inform emergency response, resource allocation decisions, and long-term resilience planning in complex humanitarian settings. Working in close collaboration with research and analysis teams across the field and in HQ, the global GIS & Remote Sensing team ensures the collection, processing and analysis of relevant satellite imagery and geo-spatial data to monitor crisis-affected areas, assess needs, map population movements, and identify vulnerabilities among affected populations. Within this set-up, and under the supervision of the Head of Research, Learning and Technological Transformation, the GIS & Remote Sensing Specialist will be responsible for producing global analysis products, as well as technical backstopping to global and country teams for the implementation of relevant programmes, including, but not limited to, humanitarian emergencies and climate response efforts.

The candidate should have a strong technical background in Remote Sensing, GIS and climate data analysis, and prior experience with analysis of satellite imagery with different spatial and spectral resolutions. The candidate should also understand concepts of cartographic design and be experienced in presentation of the results of spatial analysis using static and interactive mapping products.
Co-lead the design of IMPACT‚Äôs global GIS & Remote Sensing Strategy, and ensure successful delivery through the development of guidelines, tools, and learning materials
Produce global products in line with IMPACT‚Äôs standards and strategic priorities (exact scope and priority areas of focus to be defined)
Provide technical backstopping and support for the successful implementation of relevant research and analysis programmes
column2: including:

column1: Guide global and country teams on planning and design in line with project objectives and IMPACT‚Äôs GIS & Remote Sensing guidelines
Support with the drafting and review of research ToRs, with a specific focus on the analysis plan, data management plan, and key remote sensing and geospatial analysis methodologies
Support with the production and review of relevant analysis outputs
Support with the development, maintenance of global partnerships, including:
Coordination with UNOSAT for the planning and procurement of services and satellite imagery
Representation in relevant meetings/ Working Groups and presentation of research findings to third parties to enhance their use and impact
Promote active use of datasets, GIS products, and research findings by partners and the broader humanitarian community for their decision making.
Additional Tasks (on An Ad-hoc, By Need Basis)

Provide other support for the implementation of IMPACT programmes as needed (e.g. data processing and analysis, technical supervision and capacity strengthening support), including in-country or remote surge to support to country teams
Proactively monitor best practices and emerging innovations in remote sensing, and as relevant, undertake research and development to incorporate innovative techniques into IMPACT‚Äôs work
Excellent academic qualifications, preferably a Master degree or higher related to GIS, Remote Sensing, Geography or Environmental sciences
At least 5-6 years of relevant work experience with remote sensing and geo-spatial analysis

column2: fluency in French or Spanish also an asset

column1: Integrity i.e. commitment to acting professionally while holding oneself and others accountable by operating with transparency and taking responsibility for one‚Äôs actions
Learning i.e. commitment towards personal and professional growth through a perspective of learning and thinking creatively
Resilience i.e. ability to effectively maintain focus on professional objectives while adapting and demonstrating flexibility as contexts, requirements and circumstances change
Interpersonal skills i.e. ability to effectively communicate and build relationships with others, internally and externally
Collaboration i.e. ability to work cooperatively with others from a diversity of backgrounds and viewpoints, engaging effectively internally and externally
Producing quality results i.e. operationalize objectives in an organized manner, delivering results on time and to a high standard of quality
Problem solving i.e. ability to use analytical and critical thinking to form sound judgments and inform evidence-based decisions
Strategy implementation Strategy Setting i.e. ability to create a clear and compelling strategy and course of action relevant for the context
Global research and analysis Research Planning i.e. ability to formulate appropriate research questions and methodologies based on the information landscape and the available resources

Geospatial Analysis i.e. ability to process spatial data for making calculations, identify spatial patterns, and relationships, including design and implementation of complex analysis (hot spot analysis, raster multi-criteria analysis, etc.)

Remote Sensing i.e. ability to follow remote sensing related procedures and processes, identify suitable tools and data sources, and perform relevant analysis, including intermediate-advanced working knowledge of ArcGIS Pro imagery processing tools and Google Earth Engine
Communicating Data i.e. effectively translate and disseminate research findings through accurate and effective research outputs
Mapping Visualisation i.e. ability to make maps that effectively communicate clear and accurate information, and advanced working knowledge of ArcGIS Pro
GIS Data Management i.e. ability to manage and use GIS data while maintaining data quality, including ability to work with a wide range of GIS databases
Technical guidance and capacity sharing Facilitating Learning i.e. ability to nurture professional growth and individual learning in others
External engagement Writing with Impact i.e. ability to write formally in a clear, structured, and compelling manner for external stakeholders
Speaking with Impact i.e. ability to speak formally in a clear, structured, and compelling manner to external stakeholders

For this position, gross salary between 5‚Äô800 CHF and 5‚Äô957 CHF monthly (before income tax). NB - IMPACT salaries are strictly determined by our salary grid depending on the grade of the position and the level of education and experience of staff. A contribution to medical insurance of 489 CHF per month is already included in the salary figure.
Insurance covering professional and non-professional accidents throughout the period of employment with IMPACT
Health insurance, life insurance and repatriation assistance in case of field visits/temporary deployments
Enrolment in IMPACT Initiatives Research Foundational Learning Programme within the first 3 months from the start of contract.
Applicants must hold a valid work permit for Switzerland or be EU/EFTA citizens
Up to 40% of remote work on a weekly basis.

4259583090,https://br.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-kaizen-gaming-4259583090?position=48&pageNum=0&refId=L6AvJwu5TAOicwtYO1olsQ%3D%3D&trackingId=nqCzgEo2hu1h1nE%2BAtQ%2FLw%3D%3D,Data Analyst,Kaizen Gaming,"S√£o Paulo, S√£o Paulo, Brazil","We are Kaizen Gaming

Kaizen Gaming, the team powering Betano, is one of the biggest GameTech companies in the world, operating in 19 markets. We always aim to leverage cutting-edge technology, providing the best experience to our millions of customers who trust us for their entertainment.
We are a diverse team of more than 2.700 Kaizeners, from 40+ nationalities spreading across 3 continents.
Our #oneteam is proud to be among the Best Workplaces in Europe and certified Great Place to Work across our offices. Here, there‚Äôll be no average day for you. Ready to Press Play on Potential?
We are looking for an outstanding Data Analyst to join our fast-growing BI & Analytics team and contribute to the expansion of our Kaizen Gaming functions during an exciting scale-up data journey.
As a Data Analyst you will:
Build strong relationships with stakeholders, proactively providing data analyses and insights to the function
Interpret KPIs with a clear understanding on results vs. expected targets
Communicate insights and recommendations effectively to stakeholders enabling them to make better-informed business decisions
Continuously assess and refine existing metrics and KPIs and work closely with the rest of Business Intelligence (BI) to develop new ones that drive business growth
Work closely with the rest of BI team to ensure alignment, adopt best practices in data visualization, and facilitate seamless information flow from the hub to the spoke and vice versa
Contribute to fostering a strong data-driven culture across the organization
Design and develop data intelligence solutions, including analysis, reporting and dashboards of key metrics and KPIs.
Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative discipline such as Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Operations Research, or similar
Experience in a reporting, statistical or quantitative role‚Äîexperience in the gaming industry would be considered a plus
Analytical mindset and detail-oriented with ability to focus and prioritize workload
Exceptional data storytelling skills and the ability to articulate technical information to a non-technical audience
Strategic thinker with the ability to collaborate and engage with senior stakeholders
High drive, can-do attitude, proactive, and adaptable to changing business demands
Advanced proficiency in SQL, as well as strong skills in MS-Excel and Google Sheets (pivot tables, v-lookups)
Working experience with Microsoft Power BI would be considered a plus (or other dashboarding tools such as Tableau)
Working experience with Python would also be considered a plus (especially Pandas, Numpy, and other relevant libraries for data analysis)

At Kaizen Gaming, we value innovation, collaboration and continuous improvement. If you're passionate about leveraging data to drive business success and thrive in a fast-paced environment, we'd love to hear from you.

La persona si occuper√† di mappatura, analisi e reingegnerizzazione dei processi aziendali, revisione e formalizzazione della normativa interna, definizione dei modelli operativi di funzionamento, gestione della job architecture aziendale e delle job evaluation manageriali, supporto specialistico per i progetti strategici del Gruppo.
In particolare, tale attivit√† dovr√† essere svolta con riferimento al processo di integrazione delle competenze funzionali al percorso di trasformazione aziendale in atto.

Conoscenza MS Office Excel, Word e Power Point

Alle persone interessate viene richiesta una seniority di almento due anni, oltre a spiccate capacit√† di relazione, negoziazione e comunicazione, proattivit√†, propensione a lavorare in team, capacit√† di problem solving, orientamento al risultato.
Costituiscono, infine, titoli preferenziali la conoscenza di PowerBI e di strumenti di Data Analysis, AI, SAP, Success Factor.
Offriamo un contratto di lavoro a tempo indeterminato e formazione continua, unitamente all‚Äôopportunit√† di lavorare in un contesto dinamico e strategico per il presidio dei processi di TIM.

With over 5,000 employees based in more than 80 countries across the globe, our teams provide industry leading expertise that spans:
Building trust since 1931, our proven track record means that we now partner with almost every car manufacturer on the market.
To empower Movers and Makers to thrive in our ever-changing world
To harness our expertise in mobility, the creativity of our global teams,
and the power of technology, to craft tailored and innovative solutions
To enhance every journey in the world of mobility
Are you an automotive fan and have a passion for data analysis? Do you enjoy collecting and analyzing data to detect improvements? MSXI has the job for you!
MSX is looking for a proactive and enthusiastic Business Data Analyst to join our team in Rome.

As part of our team, you will support the data management and analysis processes as well as the development and deployment of our Data and AI literacy program. Your primary responsibilities will include collecting, organizing, and interpreting data to help guide decision-making processes. Your key tasks will be:
Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualizations that provide insights into Lean program performance and business operations
Document processes, findings, and recommendations clearly and effectively for both technical and non-technical audiences

We would love to welcome a new colleague passionate about the automotive field, oriented to teamwork and taking the good dose of initiative to achieve results. Our ideal Business Data Analyst has a Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or a related technical field, as well as:
3+ years experience as a Business Analyst, with background in data analytics and AI
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen attention to detail
Entry level knowledge of SQL, ETL processes, and data modeling
Experience with BI tools and data visualization platforms such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a dynamic and fast-paced environment
Experience of planning complex schedules of activities
If you‚Äôre ready to make an impact and contribute to our company‚Äôs success, apply now!

At MSX, our employees are the force behind our success. We are dedicated to empowering and encouraging our people and offer flexible working methods to suit all. We are a Disability Confident Committed organisation who takes pride in our diverse workforce.
In Joining MSX, You Can Enjoy
You can learn more about MSX International on our website: www.msxi.com

MSX is an equal opportunities employer and positively encourages applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, religion or belief, marital status, or pregnancy or maternity. As users of the disability confident scheme, we guarantee to interview all disabled applicants who meet the minimum criteria for the vacancy.

Your primary responsibilities will include collecting, organizing, and interpreting data to help guide decision-making processes. Your key tasks will be:

    • Provide data-driven recommendations to stakeholder
    • Document processes, findings, and recommendations clearly and effectively for both technical and non-technical audiences

    Qualifications

    About

    We would love to welcome a new colleague passionate about the automotive field, oriented to teamwork and taking the good dose of initiative to achieve results. Our ideal Business Data Analyst has a Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or a related technical field, as well as:

    • Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a dynamic and fast-paced environment
    • Experience of planning complex schedules of activities
    • Fluent level of English

    If you‚Äôre ready to make an impact and contribute to our company‚Äôs success, apply now!

Combinerai informatica, matematica, statistica e business per creare analisi predittive, presentandole e comunicandole con professionalit√† e competenza. Opererai in un ambiente orientato all'innovazione tecnologica, occupandoti di Data Science, Advanced Analytics, Predictive Maintenance, Natural Language Processing e molto altro! Abbiamo ricevuto riconoscimenti internazionali per quanto riguarda la nostra capacit√† di interpretare e gestire i dati.
Integrazione dei dati: capire quali fonti di dati sono importanti e come devono essere trattate al fine di potenziare nuovi strumenti e metodologie Data Driven
Modellazione: sviluppo di nuovi modelli di Machine Learning ad hoc per soddisfare le richieste e i requisiti aziendali
Piattaforme di analisi avanzate: Sviluppo di pipeline ML complete, dall'ingestione dei dati alle applicazioni frontend.

Incontri ed eventi orientati al business: concentrandosi fortemente sulla condivisione con gli utenti aziendali dei dettagli del progetto, si costruisce la fiducia nello strumento e nella metodologia utilizzata per svilupparlo
Come As You Are - Le tue competenze e caratteristiche
Questa opportunit√† √® perfetta per te se:
Possiedi una Laurea in Data Science, Informatica, Ingegneria Informatica, Ingegneria Matematica, Statistica o altra ritenuta attinente
Hai una buona conoscenza dei principali linguaggi di programmazione come Python e SAS
Hai competenze nella comprensione del ciclo di vita dei modelli: preparazione dei dati dell'ultimo miglio, sviluppo di modelli di intelligenza artificiale e distribuzione in un'infrastruttura cloud
Hai una buona conoscenza di: Data Warehouse, estrazione, manipolazione e preparazione dei dati
Hai competenze di base di Data Visualization, con soluzioni Enterprise (es. PowerBI) o soluzioni open-source come ggplot o plotly
Hai competenze di base con le principali piattaforme cloud (Azure, AWS)
Hai una buona padronanza della lingua inglese, preferibilmente con esperienze di studio e/o lavoro all'estero
Your Future With Us - Cosa troverai in KPMG
Un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, equo e che rispetta, incoraggia e valorizza le diversit√†
Un contesto stimolante e dinamico che incentiva la creativit√† e il lavoro di squadra
Modalit√† di lavoro ibrida, per promuovere un sano equilibrio tra vita lavorativa e personale
Programmi di formazione e sviluppo avanzati per rimanere sempre aggiornati

Leadership, lavoro in team, rispetto di ogni individualit√†, approfondimento continuo, trasparenza, impegno verso la comunit√†, integrit√†: questi sono i Valori di KPMG che danno vita a un ambiente aperto allo scambio di idee e di conoscenza, che permette ai nostri professionisti di esprimere tutto il loro potenziale.

Grazie all‚Äôimpegno nel favorire un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, il nostro Network risulta conforme agli standard dei requisiti ISO 30415, sul Sistema di Gestione per la Diversit√† e l‚ÄôInclusione, e UNI PdR 125, relativa alla parit√† di genere. KPMG Advisory S.p.A. garantisce le pari opportunit√†.
We let the future guide us. Join our next generation

Do you want to do work that is truly meaningful and impactful? At KPMG you will have the opportunity to help clients, society, and colleagues address and solve the most current and complex challenges. KPMG Advisory provides consulting services to companies to assist them in business model transformation, process improvement and digitization, risk analysis and management, and support in extraordinary finance transactions.
Specifically, you will join the Lighthouse Team in Rome.
Lighthouse is KPMG Advisory's center of excellence offering Data & Analytics solutions in the market.

Joining the team, you will develop innovative solutions drawing on our global expertise. You will combine computer science, mathematics, statistics and business to create predictive analytics, presenting and communicating them with professionalism and expertise. You will work in a technology innovation-oriented environment, dealing with Data Science, Advanced Analytics, Predictive Maintenance, Natural Language Processing and more! We have received international recognition for our ability to interpret and manage data.
Specifically, you will be involved in:
Data Integration: understanding which data sources are important and how they should be treated in order to enhance new Data Driven tools and methodologies
Modeling: developing new Machine Learning models ad hoc to meet business demands and requirements
Advanced Analytics Platforms: Development of complete ML pipelines from data ingestion to frontend applications.
Business-oriented meetings and events: Strong focus on sharing project details with business users builds confidence in the tool and the methodology used to develop it
Come As You Are - Your Skills And Characteristics.
This opportunity is perfect for you if:
You hold a Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Mathematical Engineering, Statistics or other deemed relevant
You have a good understanding of major programming languages such as Python and SAS
You have skills in understanding the model lifecycle: last mile data preparation, artificial intelligence model development and deployment in a cloud infrastructure
You have a good understanding of: Data Warehouse, data extraction, manipulation and preparation
You have basic skills in Data Visualization, with Enterprise solutions (e.g., PowerBI) or open-source solutions such as ggplot or plotly
You have basic skills with major cloud platforms (Azure, AWS)
You have a good command of the English language, preferably with study and/or work experience abroad
Your Future With Us - What you will find at KPMG.
An inclusive, equitable work environment that respects, encourages and values diversity
A stimulating and dynamic environment that encourages creativity and teamwork
Hybrid work mode to promote a healthy work-life balance
Advanced training and development programs to stay current
Initiatives focused on mental and physical well-being
Together for Better - Our Values and Commitment

Leadership, teamwork, respect for each individuality, continuous deepening, transparency, commitment to the community, integrity: these are KPMG's Values that give rise to an environment open to the exchange of ideas and knowledge, enabling our professionals to reach their full potential.

As a result of our commitment to fostering an inclusive work environment, our Network complies with the standards of the ISO 30415 requirements, on the Diversity and Inclusion Management System, and UNI PdR 125, relating to gender equality. Within our Impact Plan - Our Impact Plan (kpmg.com) - you will find summarized all the actions we are taking on environmental, social and governance (ESG) issues.

Your data will be processed in full compliance with the provisions of Regulation (EU) No. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - ‚ÄúGDPR‚Äù) as amended. For more information, please see KPMG's privacy policy.

4263086862,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-intelligence-analyst-at-immobiliare-it-mutui-4263086862?position=12&pageNum=0&refId=OHyNVewzKhNUkztwYbSPYw%3D%3D&trackingId=HL007WT0PRWDD%2Fz9ZZabMA%3D%3D,Business Intelligence Analyst,Immobiliare.it Mutui,"Rome, Latium, Italy","Chi Siamo

Immobiliare.it Mutui √® l'app N.1 dei mutui. Aiutiamo gratuitamente chi ha in mente l'acquisto di una casa a trovare il mutuo ideale. √à stata lanciata nel 2024, preceduta da Mutuiamo nel 2019. La nostra mission √® quella di eliminare l'ostacolo del mutuo per trasformarlo in uno strumento per chi vuole comprare casa.
Per farlo, abbiamo creato un ecosistema basato su 3 pilastri: i) innovazione tecnologica ii) esperti mutuo in-house e iii) banche leader come key partners.
Per questo motivo stiamo cercando un Business Intelligence Analyst da inserire nel nostro Team nella nostra sede operativa di Roma.

4261062887,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/analytics-insight-internship-at-procter-gamble-4261062887?position=16&pageNum=0&refId=OHyNVewzKhNUkztwYbSPYw%3D%3D&trackingId=Lykki299X1xcFxJs3ZsC%2BA%3D%3D,Analytics & Insight Internship,Procter & Gamble,"Rome, Latium, Italy","Do you have a passion to influence business strategy, product design, commercial vision and the media landscape? An ambition to drive the change through deep consumer understanding and advanced analytics is also what we are looking for!
If so, then this role is perfect for you!

In Analytics & Insights (A&I), we use our boundless curiosity to discover what consumers want, why they want it and how we can we influence them through immersive exploration and big data analytics. We uncover unexpected insights and innovate the way P&G runs business.
A career in A&I will build your ability to influence and think strategically, across a breadth of experiences on multiple P&G business.
As An Intern In Analytics And Insights, You Will
Act as a business strategy consultant, guiding decisions of P&G Top management in several business domains (consumer, customer, digital etc.)
Be part of a multi-functional business team, working closely with Marketing, Finance, Sales, R&D and others, constantly exploring new opportunities for business growth
Combine analytical expertise and deep consumer understanding, to anticipate opportunities and answer critical business questions

Grow your skills continuously, improving your mastery in big data analytics, as well as immersive in-depth researches. You will have the opportunity to explore new ways to learn and to connect with internal and external guides worldwide.
Responsibilities as of Day 1 ‚Äì You will be given specific projects and responsibilities working on real and live business challenges, just like a true P&Ger
Continuous coaching ‚Äì You will work with passionate people and receive both formal training as well as day-to-day mentoring from your manager
Dynamic and respectful work environment ‚Äì Employees are at the core, we value every individual and encourage initiatives, promoting work/life balance
Compensation & Benefits: you will receive a competitive internship salary as well as other benefits whilst you are with us.
Just apply online via clicking the button below
Attach any documents you consider relevant: motivation letter, recommendations, certificates etc.

The position is based in our HQ in Rome and part of the Global team.

The Data Scientist's mission is to empower Fendi with data-driven insights that fuel strategic decision-making, enhance customer understanding, and drive business growth. By leveraging analytical expertise and a deep understanding of the business, the Data Scientist's will identify opportunities for optimization, improve operational efficiency, and contribute to Fendi's continued success in the luxury fashion market.

As part of the LVMH Group, this role also involves collaborating and interfacing with other entities within the group, providing a broader perspective and exposure to a diverse range of business challenges and opportunities.
Proficiency in machine learning and artificial intelligence algorithms with a strong understanding of their practical applications.
Design, develop, and deploy AI/ML models to address complex business challenges, optimize operational efficiency, and deliver actionable strategic insights.

Expertise in analyzing large, diverse datasets using advanced statistical and AI techniques to identify key trends, patterns, and correlations, transforming these insights into clear, data-driven recommendations for business stakeholders.
Proven experience working with customer and sales data, particularly within a retail/consumer environment, to drive targeted business outcomes.
Expertise in data collection, cleansing, and comprehensive analysis of large datasets from various sources, including customer, sales, and operational data repositories.
Conduct ad-hoc data analysis to address specific business inquiries and support informed decision-making processes across the organization.
Measure the impact and effectiveness of strategic initiatives and marketing campaigns using appropriate metrics and rigorous statistical methodologies.
Measure the results of initiatives and campaigns using appropriate metrics and statistical methods.
Collaborate closely with business stakeholders to understand their requirements and translate them into clear, well-defined data analysis projects.
Communicate complex findings, insights, and strategic recommendations to both technical and non-technical audiences in a clear, concise, and persuasive manner.
Actively participate in cross-functional projects, providing data-driven insights and support for key business initiatives.
Manage relationships with data vendors, ensuring service level agreements (SLAs) are met and data quality is maintained.
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, or a related field.
3-5 years of experience in a data scientist role.
Proficiency in Python and R programming languages.
Experience with data visualization tools, mainly Power BI.
Strong SQL skills and experience with relational databases.
Familiarity with cloud computing platforms, preferably Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
Knowledge of statistical modelling techniques. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team and perform under pressure in a fast-paced.
Evidence of successful delivery of data driven analysis and recommendations to drive forward business performance.
Critical thinking and attention to detail, extremely organized and high attention to luxury and detail
Demonstrated interest in keeping up with emerging technologies and the data trend.
Fluency in English and Italian are a mus
LVMH is committed to non-discrimination and respect of each person‚Äôs singularities. We recognize and recruit all types of talent

Position

Data Scientist

Job Responsibilities

The position is based in our HQ in Rome and part of the Global team.

The Data Scientist's mission is to empower Fendi with data-driven insights that fuel strategic decision-making, enhance customer understanding, and drive business growth. By leveraging analytical expertise and a deep understanding of the business, the Data Scientist's will identify opportunities for optimization, improve operational efficiency, and contribute to Fendi's continued success in the luxury fashion market.

As part of the LVMH Group, this role also involves collaborating and interfacing with other entities within the group, providing a broader perspective and exposure to a diverse range of business challenges and opportunities.

Main Responsibilities

  • Proficiency in machine learning and artificial intelligence algorithms with a strong understanding of their practical applications.
  • Design, develop, and deploy AI/ML models to address complex business challenges, optimize operational efficiency, and deliver actionable strategic insights.
  • Expertise in analyzing large, diverse datasets using advanced statistical and AI techniques to identify key trends, patterns, and correlations, transforming these insights into clear, data-driven recommendations for business stakeholders.
  • Proven experience working with customer and sales data, particularly within a retail/consumer environment, to drive targeted business outcomes.
  • Expertise in data collection, cleansing, and comprehensive analysis of large datasets from various sources, including customer, sales, and operational data repositories.
  • Conduct ad-hoc data analysis to address specific business inquiries and support informed decision-making processes across the organization.
  • Measure the impact and effectiveness of strategic initiatives and marketing campaigns using appropriate metrics and rigorous statistical methodologies.
  • Measure the results of initiatives and campaigns using appropriate metrics and statistical methods.
  • Collaborate closely with business stakeholders to understand their requirements and translate them into clear, well-defined data analysis projects.
  • Communicate complex findings, insights, and strategic recommendations to both technical and non-technical audiences in a clear, concise, and persuasive manner.
  • Actively participate in cross-functional projects, providing data-driven insights and support for key business initiatives.
  • Manage relationships with data vendors, ensuring service level agreements (SLAs) are met and data quality is maintained.

Profile

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, or a related field.
  • 3-5 years of experience in a data scientist role.
  • Proficiency in Python and R programming languages.
  • Experience with data visualization tools, mainly Power BI.
  • Preferably experience with Dataiku.
  • Strong SQL skills and experience with relational databases.
  • Familiarity with cloud computing platforms, preferably Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
  • Knowledge of statistical modelling techniques. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Strong communication and collaboration skills.
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team and perform under pressure in a fast-paced.
  • Evidence of successful delivery of data driven analysis and recommendations to drive forward business performance.
  • Critical thinking and attention to detail, extremely organized and high attention to luxury and detail
  • Demonstrated interest in keeping up with emerging technologies and the data trend.
  • Fluency in English and Italian are a mus

Additional Information

LVMH is committed to non-discrimination and respect of each person‚Äôs singularities. We recognize and recruit all types of talent

4074546905,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/junior-data-analytics-engineer-at-immobiliare-it-4074546905?position=33&pageNum=0&refId=OHyNVewzKhNUkztwYbSPYw%3D%3D&trackingId=ibF5Qhts%2B14OG84Yrf3jrQ%3D%3D,Junior Data Analytics Engineer,Immobiliare.it,"Rome, Latium, Italy","Immobiliare.it S.p.A. is an Italian group composed of companies specializing in Digital Tech services for the sale and rental of real estate, aimed at individuals, real estate professionals, banking institutions and financial sector operators.

Founded in 2005, Immobiliare.it, the No. 1 real estate portal in Italy, has expanded its offering with specialized portals such as Trovacasa.it, MioAffitto and LuxuryEstate.com, dedicated to luxury properties.

Immobiliare.it Insights, the company's proptech division, offers digital advisory, insights and data diligence services to banks, investors and appraisers. A leading player in Italy in the mortgage sector, the group includes Immobiliare.it Mutui, specializing in remote credit brokerage, Euroansa with a network of over 800 credit brokers throughout the country and Genio Diligence, a company focused on credit risk and fraud prevention for brokers and financial institutions. The group is also present in foreign markets in Spain (Pisos.com, Indomio.es and Enalquiler.com), Greece (Spitogatos.gr, Indomio.gr), Slovenia (Nekretnine.net) and Croatia (Crozilla.com and Indomio.hr).
We are looking for a Junior Data Analytics Engineer to join our Marketing team.
marketing analytics: measurement of marketing campaigns with a focus on causality, optimization and data-driven decision-making
data management and architecture: data warehousing and big data analytics using cloud technologies (GCP, AWS) and open-source tools (Airflow, dataform, dbt)
data pipelines: design and manage reliable marketing data pipelines to provide new insights and detect threats and opportunities

data products: build end-to-end marketing data products combining internal data with several external sources like market and industry trends (e.g. market data, Google searches, online research) and competitive intelligence tools (e.g. Similarweb, data.ai, Semrush).
new graduate in Engineering, Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, Physics
analytical mindset with a problem solving approach
curious and passionate about marketing and tech platforms
fluent in English and working knowledge of Italian.
Our team is responsible for all marketing activities of our Group: Immobiliare.it (Italy), Indomio.es (Spain), Immotop.lu (Luxembourg), Crozilla.com (Croatia) and LuxuryEstate (Global)

performance marketing: we design, create and manage campaigns with different business objectives (e.g. user acquisition and engagement, lead generation and brand awareness). We are one of the top advertisers in our markets, we collaborate with the best partners and our strong relationship with them allow us to develop ad-hoc projects and to access new features, products and technologies before they‚Äôre widely released

analytics: Our products generate hundreds of millions of events every day, by analysing these interactions we can learn about our customers and their experience, optimise marketing investments, uncover new opportunities, and support data-driven decision-making.

market and competitor insights: we study the real estate market and our industry to uncover emerging trends, discover business opportunities and forecast demand as accurately as possible to stay ahead of the curve
projects: we drive growth, operational and technological improvements working cross-team and cross-competence (Tech, Product, Sales, PR & Content teams).
a young and dynamic work environment
an opportunity in a fast-growing company
paid internship contract or fixed contract
free coffee and fresh fruit every day
break room with a foosball table
office located in the centre of Rome (Termini).
This announcement is addressed to people of any sex, pursuant to laws 903/77 and 125/91, and to people of all ages and all nationalities, pursuant to legislative decrees 215/03 and 216/03.

4263725169,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/internship-within-the-end-of-life-management-supply-chain-team-at-fendi-4263725169?position=38&pageNum=0&refId=OHyNVewzKhNUkztwYbSPYw%3D%3D&trackingId=6X723gUWEDinq8IBKSEekA%3D%3D,Internship within the End-of-Life Management Supply Chain team,Fendi,"Rome, Latium, Italy","Position

The intern will support the End-of-Life-Management Intern team in analysing and visualizing data concerning outlet and braderie sales channels, and in informing decision-making and strategy development for animating the off-price business, while protecting brand image, using Power BI and other analytical tools.
This position is based in Rome HQ.
Support in analysing and interpreting sales and stock data for outlet and braderie channels with the aim of identify trends and opportunities for improvement.

Assist in maintaining Power BI dashboards and reports to visualize key metrics and performance indicators, collaborating in improving stock coverage and sell-through for more efficient stock management.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, such as merchandising and visual merchandising, to learn how to enhance the outlet business, focusing on assortment and display strategies.
Support the team in liaising with the pricing team to define appropriate pricing policies for promo periods by analysing competitor benchmarks within the market.
Assist the team in the preparation of new online events by acquiring knowledge on managing assortment, purchase rules, and discount policies, while adhering to company procedure
Bachelor's or master‚Äôs program in Data Science, Statistics, or Engineering
A previous experience in data analysis and visualization will be a plus
This six-months internship will start in September 2025.
LVMH is committed to non-discrimination and respect of each person‚Äôs singularities. We recognize and recruit all types of talent

Position

The intern will support the End-of-Life-Management Intern team in analysing and visualizing data concerning outlet and braderie sales channels, and in informing decision-making and strategy development for animating the off-price business, while protecting brand image, using Power BI and other analytical tools.

This position is based in Rome HQ.

Job Responsibilities

  • Support in analysing and interpreting sales and stock data for outlet and braderie channels with the aim of identify trends and opportunities for improvement.
  • Assist in maintaining Power BI dashboards and reports to visualize key metrics and performance indicators, collaborating in improving stock coverage and sell-through for more efficient stock management.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams, such as merchandising and visual merchandising, to learn how to enhance the outlet business, focusing on assortment and display strategies.
  • Support the team in liaising with the pricing team to define appropriate pricing policies for promo periods by analysing competitor benchmarks within the market.
  • Assist the team in the preparation of new online events by acquiring knowledge on managing assortment, purchase rules, and discount policies, while adhering to company procedure

Profile

  • Bachelor's or master‚Äôs program in Data Science, Statistics, or Engineering
  • Proficiency in Power BI
  • Excellent skills in Excel
  • Strong quantitative and analytical skills
  • A previous experience in data analysis and visualization will be a plus
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Team working and proactive approach

This six-months internship will start in September 2025.

LVMH is committed to non-discrimination and respect of each person‚Äôs singularities. We recognize and recruit all types of talent

4264704255,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-engineer-at-engie-italia-4264704255?position=49&pageNum=0&refId=OHyNVewzKhNUkztwYbSPYw%3D%3D&trackingId=HFY7zCqib9GPJQEkzkD9%2Fg%3D%3D,Data Engineer,ENGIE Italia,"Rome, Latium, Italy","Energy Management (EM) is responsible for the management of the ENGIE Group's assets, ensuring competitive energy for customers while optimizing created value, within a consistent risk framework.

ENGIE is a global reference in low-carbon energy and services with a leading energy management business, piloted by its Global Business Unit Supply & Energy Management (S&EM) who built its savoir-faire managing the Group‚Äôs large and diverse asset portfolio over 20+ years.

15,000 employees around the world develop our solutions, through +20 international business platforms. We cover the full energy mix: renewable and thermal power, natural gas & LNG, biomass, environmental products. Our experts provide tailor made solutions based on a wide range of savoir-faire in energy management with a strong focus on decarbonation and decentralization.

Our +120,000 clients span the entire value chain: producers, asset developers, financial players, utilities, distributors and industrials. Our global reach and strong local presence enable us to offer these diverse clients tailor-made services and respond to rapid changes in mature or emerging markets alike.
At GEM we encourage breakthrough results, team spirit, curiosity and innovation while preserving the right work/life balance for you.
More info on GEM Hub (https://gems.engie.com) or LinkedIn (https://www.linkedin.com/company/engie-global-energy-management-solutions).

EM IS team provides new solutions or system integration and support to simplify and automize the business‚Äô daily activities. We have a multi cloud platform, with all the applications and classic DWH projects are hosted as a PaaS architecture in Azure while there is a data lake hosted in AWS and several Machine learning projects are being migrated in this platform.
Based on its perimeter defined by IS Cloud & Data Science Manager, the candidate will learn have the following responsibilities:
Analyze and manage large volumes of data using SQL and data engineering tools.
Implement and scale solutions on AWS cloud for model training and inference.
Create and maintain interactive dashboards and reports to support strategic decisions.
Collaborate with internal teams and stakeholders to understand business needs and propose data-driven solutions.
Integrate models with external systems through the development or use of RESTful APIs.
Ensure data quality and robustness of developed models.
Develop and maintain data ingestion and ETL systems.
Develop and optimize machine learning models for time series forecasting in the energy sector.
The ideal profile matches with the followings prerequisites:
Bachelor's degree in STEM disciplines (Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Physics, Statistics, or related fields)
Excellent knowledge of Python and SQL for data analysis and modeling.
At least 2 years of experience in Data Science roles, with a focus on time series forecasting using Machine Learning and Deep Learning techniques.
Experience in developing and implementing solutions on AWS (e.g., Lambda, S3, SageMaker, Redshift, etc.).
Knowledge of energy market dynamics, with particular reference to spot markets and energy commodities.
Experience in developing reinforcement learning models for automated trading applications.
Experience with MLOps frameworks and CI/CD for model deployment.
The Data Engineer for EM strives to provide the highest possible quality of services such as the analysis, development and deployment of innovative solutions to the GEMS users.
Excellent command of written and spoken English for working in international contexts.
Interactive behavior: Active Listening and verbal and written communication skills.
Problem solving: Issues perception, analyzing, practical thinking, creativity, innovation.
Personal effectiveness: Facilitation skills, pragmatism and pro-activity, taking initiative.
Ability to communicate complex results to technical and non-technical stakeholders through dashboards and reports.
Local contract according to Italian labor law.

Our group is a global reference in low-carbon energy and services. Our purpose (‚Äúraison d‚Äô√™tre‚Äù) is to act to accelerate the transition towards a carbon-neutral world, through reduced energy consumption and more environmentally-friendly solutions, reconciling economic performance with a positive impact on people and the planet. We rely on our key businesses (gas, renewable energy, services) to offer competitive solutions to our customers. With our 170,000 employees, our customers, partners and stakeholders, we are a community of Imaginative Builders, committed every day to more harmonious progress.
Recognized for 2025 by Sole24Ore as a leading company in diversity & inclusion, the ISO 30415:2021 and UNI PDR 125:2022 certifications are further proof of our commitment.

4266891440,https://in.linkedin.com/jobs/view/opening-for-consultant-australia-at-aecc-india-4266891440?position=4&pageNum=2&refId=wQC9DFCj9pNRkbLgnoZ1WQ%3D%3D&trackingId=eNJZvI%2F0qSbYlQMQjb8UEA%3D%3D,Opening for Consultant-Australia,aecc india,"Ludhiana, Punjab, India","Experience Required- Minimum 2 years experience in Student Counselling dealing with Australia Study programs

AECC Global is a leading education consultancy founded in 2008 with a global footprint in 16 countries and 58 cities and continually growing, AECC Global is an education and migration agency that is making waves internationally. Headquartered in beautiful Melbourne, we take pride in our commitment to helping our clients actualize their foreign education and immigration dreams with ethical, unbiased and honest guidance. Our 800+ staff members speak 21 different languages and have serviced students from over 40 different nationalities in the years that we have been in operation. 1000+ top universities and schools globally have entrusted us as representatives, and we help students find their dream education in Australia, USA, UK, Canada, NZ and Ireland by guiding them in each step from course options, school selection, scholarships, credits, application process, visa grants, arrival and ongoing support making their overseas education journey as seamless as possible.
Handling student walk-ins for Abroad study destination-Australia, effectively address their queries regarding Studying abroad and provide comprehensive consultancy with end-to-end solution.
Attain complete understanding of Students eligibility & suggest the most appropriate Country, Course and University/College.
Provide detailed and accurate information regarding Admission and Visa documentation and other mandatory requirements.
Responsibly handle all aspects of Admission process from Case filing with university, updating the students through regular communication, Visa application filing and address to any student query.
Stay updated with all changes in policies, procedures & requirements for destination countries.
Follow up with the potential students post their visit and ensure effective closure.
Capable of preparing MIS reports as required by Management.
Minimum 2 years of experience in Overseas Education Counselling in dealing Australia

We are an eclectic mix of 100+ professionals with diverse skill sets ranging from running operations/support, supply chain know-how, analytics and the holy grail, first principles Problem-solving.

At Meesho, we‚Äôre trying to do what's never been done before - taking e-commerce to the masses. This leaves us with no choice but to completely reimagine logistics from the ground up, to cater to our customers' price and delivery expectations. That means a host of ""zero-to-one"" projects (takers, anyone?) to build a supply chain to change how folks think about e-Commerce ‚Äì not just in India, but globally.
We are firm believers in fun at work. With monthly F&E happy hour sessions, informal team outings, and internal virtual water cooler chat sessions, there‚Äôs never a dull moment with us :).

As Cluster Head LM - Ludhiana, you‚Äôll own the onboarding and training of partners and managing operations for the entire Punjab cluster. You‚Äôll also drive key operational metrics by regularly visiting their facilities in different cities in your area. You‚Äôll take complete ownership of processes allotted to you and work with various stakeholders to achieve team goals. You‚Äôll continuously work towards identifying gaps and providing recommendations for improving our processes.
Own the onboarding and training of new partners for Last Mile operations.
Identify and onboard new partners onto the network on an ongoing basis
Track and own the performance of different partners in your cluster
Visit facilities to conduct audits and solve operational gaps
Own and drive key operational metrics end to end and achieve performance targets
Graduate or Post Graduate degree in any discipline
3-5 years of work experience in the e-commerce logistics domain, preferably in Last Mile operations
Experience in partner onboarding and training in the Last Mile and sorting operations
Experience of having worked in Ludhiana or other areas of Punjab in similar capacity would be a plus and so will the Experience in control tower and field operations

Experience Required:¬†8-12 Years (Must have hands-on experience in FR, IFR, Nylon, Coated Fabrics)

Plan, organize, and supervise the daily operations of the¬†finishing¬†department¬†specifically for¬†technical fabrics¬†like¬†FR (Flame Retardant), IFR (Inherently Flame Retardant), Nylon, and Coated fabrics.
Ensure¬†quality consistency¬†and¬†performance compliance¬†in¬†finishing¬†processes such as¬†heat setting, chemical¬†finishing, coating, calendaring, raising, sueding, and softening.
Coordinate with¬†product development¬†and¬†R&D teams¬†to trial and finalize finishes for new products and customer-specific requirements.
Manage manpower, machine maintenance schedules, and material consumption for optimal productivity.
Maintain¬†documentation¬†related to process control, quality checks, production logs, and SOPs.
Handle customer audits and ensure¬†compliance with technical and safety standards¬†.
Analyze¬†defects¬†and work closely with QA to minimize fabric rejections.
Ensure the correct application of¬†chemical formulations¬†and¬†finishing¬†recipes in coordination with chemical vendors.
Lead¬†continuous improvement initiatives¬†for productivity enhancement, energy efficiency, and waste reduction.
Degree/Diploma in¬†Textile Engineering or Chemical Processing.
Minimum¬†8 years of hands-on experience¬†in¬†technical fabric¬†finishing, with¬†deep knowledge of FR, IFR, Nylon, PU/TPU Coated, or Laminated fabrics.
Knowledge of¬†finishing¬†machines¬†such as stenters, coating heads, padding mangle, tenter frames, compactors, raising machines, and dryers.
Familiar with¬†fire-retardant standards and performance fabric certifications.
Strong leadership and team-handling skills with problem-solving ability.
Proficient in¬†MS Excel, production MIS, and ERP systems.

Job Description: Banker-Authorizer_Pipeline at IDFC FIRST Bank
Department: Retail Banking > Branch Banking > Branch

IDFC FIRST Bank is seeking a highly motivated and skilled individual to join our Retail Banking team as a Banker-Authorizer_Pipeline. As a Banker-Authorizer_Pipeline, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the smooth and efficient operation of our branch in Jalandhar, Punjab, India.
Authorize and process transactions for customers, including deposits, withdrawals, and transfers
Ensure compliance with all banking regulations and policies
Provide excellent customer service by addressing customer inquiries and concerns
Promote and cross-sell bank products and services to customers
Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of all transactions
Collaborate with other team members to achieve branch goals and targets
Assist in the training and development of new team members
Bachelor's degree in Finance, Business, or a related field
Minimum of 2 years of experience in retail banking or a similar role
Strong knowledge of banking regulations and policies
Excellent communication and customer service skills
Ability to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
Strong attention to detail and accuracy
Proficient in Microsoft Office and banking software systems
Ability to work independently and as part of a team

We offer a competitive salary and benefits package, as well as opportunities for growth and advancement within the company. If you are a driven and dedicated individual with a passion for banking, we encourage you to apply for the Banker-Authorizer_Pipeline position at IDFC FIRST Bank.

Incumbent will work in a field role aligned to the NRI Banking Vertical and report to the regional NRI Field Leadership. Main goal is to attract new customers for the bank in your assigned location. Also work with various stakeholders in the location and the NR business vertical to design and implement local customer acquisition strategies that meet the business objectives.
Drive overall customer acquisition numbers for the designated location
Evaluate and monitor sales target and performance to plan and initiate actions to achieve excellence in sales delivery
Develop customer acquisition strategies and execute them in local markets and foster customer relationships to attract new customers
Build and maintain relationships with local B2B partners to acquire new customers
Collaborate with local Branch Network and NRI Business vertical to drive leads to conversion
Provide feedback to local field leadership on customer needs and market trends
Develop the utilise ability to interact with customers & build trust through telephonic conversations
Experience: 2 to 5 years of relevant experience

Why join cargo-partner?

  • Competitive salary package
  • Attractive incentive rewards
  • Professional development
  • Exciting opportunities for career growth

Maximum health insurance coverage

General Description

  • This role is responsible for overall Sea export related activities of assigned geography

Tasks &
column2:

  • giving all cut-off‚Äôs to customer

  • MS Office
  • English language

Personal Qualification

  • Team player

  • Commercial thinking
  • Initiative
  • Responsible

cashier job involves processing customer transactions, handling payments, and providing excellent customer service. Key responsibilities include operating cash registers, scanning items, issuing receipts, and managing cash, card, and digital payments. Cashiers also handle returns, exchanges, and answer customer inquiries, ensuring a positive shopping experience.

Key Responsibilities:Transaction Processing: Operating cash registers, scanning items, calculating totals, and processing payments (cash, card, digital). Customer Service: Greeting customers, answering questions, providing assistance, and resolving issues. Cash Handling: Managing cash drawers, balancing cash at the beginning and end of shifts, and handling cash transactions accurately. Return and Exchange Processing: Handling returns, exchanges, and refunds according to store policy. Maintaining Checkout Area: Keeping the checkout area clean, organized, and well-stocked. Following Procedures: Adhering to store policies, security procedures, and safety guidelines. Teamwork: Collaborating with other team members to ensure efficient store operations. Product Knowledge: Becoming familiar with store products and promotions to assist customers and answer questions. Maintaining a Positive Attitude: Presenting a friendly and helpful demeanor to enhance the customer experience. Essential Skills:Customer Service: Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.Accuracy and Attention to Detail: Handling transactions and payments with precision.Basic Math Skills: Calculating totals, making change, and balancing cash drawers.Cash Handling: Proficiency in handling cash transactions and managing cash flow.Problem-Solving: Addressing customer issues and resolving disputes.Time Management: Managing multiple tasks and working efficiently in a fast-paced environment.POS System Proficiency: Operating point-of-sale systems and barcode scanners.Teamwork: Collaborating effectively with other team members.

mail:- info@naukripay.com

4249618810,https://in.linkedin.com/jobs/view/territory-manager-6087-at-cambridge-university-press-assessment-4249618810?position=6&pageNum=7&refId=sVszgF%2FXvQUCwz9zWnlvHA%3D%3D&trackingId=VemaBEhbAYXOu1dle1UWUQ%3D%3D,Territory Manager - 6087,Cambridge University Press & Assessment,"Jalandhar I, Punjab, India","Job Title:

We are Cambridge University Press & Assessment, a world-leading academic publisher and assessment organisation, and a proud part of the University of Cambridge. We are focused on meeting the needs of our learners, authors, and customers by bringing research, teaching, learning and assessment together.

As a Territory Manager, an individual will establish and nurture strong connections with significant clients for the vertical implementing strategic solutions to help clients accomplish their long-term objectives. The individual will lead sales function and ensure capability building across levels for the vertical in the designated area, develop and groom the sales team into a high-performance unit and promote cross-selling culture across team
column2: effectively managing the overall sales objectives, goals, and revenue of the vertical.

column1: Be the primary point of contact and establish long-term strong relationships with customers
To oversee the company's relationships with its most significant clients
Build & drive the strategy for various accounts in their region
Develop trust relationships with portfolio of clients to ensure they do not turn to competition
Acquire a thorough understanding of customer needs and requirements for retention and growth
Expand the relationships with existing customers by continuously proposing solutions that meet their objectives
Serve as the link of communication between customers and internal departments to facilitate client need fulfilment
Ensure customer success through post-sales support, managing concerns and issues faced by customers
Prepare regular reports of progress and forecasts to internal and external stakeholders using key account metrics
You should be able to interpret data and sales figures to develop business and marketing strategy.
To establish a strong presence in Schools, with special emphasis on increasing engagement
Plan and put in action steps to meet and exceed budgets
Play active role in new product introductions, product rationalizations and pricing review
Forecast planning. Creation and tracking of sales and collections: budget & achievement (variance if any to be tracked with valid reasons/justifications)
Creation and execution of Sales Plan and strategy (Including promotions and reach agenda) in alignment with CUPA India
Have in-depth product knowledge across K 12 and Cross sales products
Driving business through sales/business analytic, effectively leveraging the CRM data

Minimum 6-8 years' experience in education sales. Proven performance records with core experience in publishing, digital & blended Products, E-commerce & Ed-tech. Govt sales experience would be an added advantage.
Experience in sales and providing solutions based on customer needs
Strong communication and interpersonal skills with aptitude in building relationships with professionals of all organizational levels
Natural relationship builder with integrity, reliability, and maturity.
Capability to manage and influence senior stakeholders.
Excellent listening, problem solving, negotiation, and presentation skills.
Excellent time and project management skills.
Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite, working knowledge of Salesforce preferred.
Demonstrated consultative selling skills and focus on Account profitability.

Cambridge University Press & Assessment is committed to being a place where anyone can enjoy a successful career, where it's safe to speak up, and where we learn continuously to improve together. We welcome applications from all candidates, regardless of demographic characteristics (age, disability, educational attainment, ethnicity, gender, marital status, neurodiversity, religion, sex, and sexual identity), cultural, or social class/background.

We believe that diversity of thought, background, and approach create better outcomes. More importantly, fostering an inclusive culture is the right thing to do, and it's part of how we achieve our purpose: to contribute to society through the pursuit of education, learning and research at the highest international levels of excellence. Ensuring that anyone, no matter who they are, feels they belong here is an essential part of who we are and the contribution we make to society, and to our planet.

To enable an environment which our people can thrive in, our customers benefit from, and where work complements life, we empower everyone to manage their time and capacity, and to prioritise their wellbeing. That's why from day one everyone at Cambridge University Press & Assessment can discuss flexible working options to find the best solution for them and their role.

Department / Business Unit:

Ludhiana ‚Äì Punjab

4267174659,https://in.linkedin.com/jobs/view/ecommerce-coordinator-at-deepak-international-limited-4267174659?position=7&pageNum=7&refId=sVszgF%2FXvQUCwz9zWnlvHA%3D%3D&trackingId=J0s2aqNLBeyMomR9Y%2Bev8A%3D%3D,Ecommerce Coordinator,Deepak International Limited,"Ludhiana, Punjab, India","Company Description

Deepak International Limited, established in 1950, is a diversified group with a strong global reputation for quality products and expertise in the manufacturing and export of a wide range of batteries and power solutions under the Tuff Bull brand. From Home Inverters and Inverter Batteries to E-Rickshaw, Solar Power Solutions, VRLA, and Automotive Batteries, we empower lives and businesses worldwide

This is a full-time role for an Ecommerce Coordinator located in Ludhiana. As an Ecommerce Coordinator, you will be responsible for managing the entire e-commerce pipeline which includes managing and expanding online product listings, managing e-commerce ad campaigns, coordinating inventory availability and reconciling payments and returns.

You will handle daily online sales and customer service inquiries, analyze sales data, and coordinate with the sales and marketing teams to enhance the online presence and performance of our products. The role also involves overseeing online promotions and maintaining up-to-date knowledge of industry trends.
Proficiency in E-Commerce management and practices
Experience in selling on Amazon, Flipkart and other Ecommerce platforms.
Excellent Customer Service and Communication skills
Experience in Sales and understanding of sales processes
Ability to coordinate with Supply Chain, Inventory, Accounts and Marketing teams
Familiarity with digital marketing and SEO practices is a plus.
Bachelor's degree in Business, Marketing, or related field preferred

Company Description

Deepak International Limited, established in 1950, is a diversified group with a strong global reputation for quality products and expertise in the manufacturing and export of a wide range of batteries and power solutions under the Tuff Bull brand. From Home Inverters and Inverter Batteries to E-Rickshaw, Solar Power Solutions, VRLA, and Automotive Batteries, we empower lives and businesses worldwide


Role Description

This is a full-time role for an Ecommerce Coordinator located in Ludhiana. As an Ecommerce Coordinator, you will be responsible for managing the entire e-commerce pipeline which includes managing and expanding online product listings, managing e-commerce ad campaigns, coordinating inventory availability and reconciling payments and returns.


You will handle daily online sales and customer service inquiries, analyze sales data, and coordinate with the sales and marketing teams to enhance the online presence and performance of our products. The role also involves overseeing online promotions and maintaining up-to-date knowledge of industry trends.


Qualifications

  • Strong Analytical Skills
  • Proficiency in E-Commerce management and practices
  • Experience in selling on Amazon, Flipkart and other Ecommerce platforms.
  • Excellent Customer Service and Communication skills
  • Experience in Sales and understanding of sales processes
  • Ability to coordinate with Supply Chain, Inventory, Accounts and Marketing teams
  • Familiarity with digital marketing and SEO practices is a plus.
  • Bachelor's degree in Business, Marketing, or related field preferred

4254392193,https://in.linkedin.com/jobs/view/design-engineer-at-marshall-machines-4254392193?position=8&pageNum=7&refId=sVszgF%2FXvQUCwz9zWnlvHA%3D%3D&trackingId=AEH7suD00g6rLvakB5o5XQ%3D%3D,Design Engineer,Marshall Machines,"Ludhiana, Punjab, India","Marshall Machines, a leader in the Machinery Manufacturing industry, is seeking a talented and passionate Design Engineer to join our innovative team. In this role, you will have the opportunity to work on cutting-edge projects, designing and developing machinery that meets our high standards of efficiency, reliability, and performance. Our ideal candidate is a creative problem solver with a strong foundation in engineering principles and a passion for driving advancements in machinery manufacturing. At Marshall Machines, you will collaborate with a team of skilled professionals in a dynamic environment where your contributions will directly impact the company's success. If you are ready to take your engineering skills to the next level and make a significant contribution to our industry-leading products, we encourage you to apply.
Root cause Analysis and Corrective actions
Good knowledge of Solid works and Autocad
Understanding of basics of Manufacturing processes - Casting, Machining, Sheetmetal
Opportunity to learn from Industry leaders
Join Marshall Machines as a Design Engineer and be a part of the cutting-edge technology in Machinery Manufacturing. Apply now and take your career to new heights!

Marshall Machines, a leader in the Machinery Manufacturing industry, is seeking a talented and passionate Design Engineer to join our innovative team. In this role, you will have the opportunity to work on cutting-edge projects, designing and developing machinery that meets our high standards of efficiency, reliability, and performance. Our ideal candidate is a creative problem solver with a strong foundation in engineering principles and a passion for driving advancements in machinery manufacturing. At Marshall Machines, you will collaborate with a team of skilled professionals in a dynamic environment where your contributions will directly impact the company's success. If you are ready to take your engineering skills to the next level and make a significant contribution to our industry-leading products, we encourage you to apply.


Tasks

Sheetmetal and Mechanical Structure 3D modelling


2D drawing generation


Manufacturing drawings and process flow


Bill of Material creation


Prototyping


Root cause Analysis and Corrective actions


Requirements

Good knowledge of Solid works and Autocad


Understanding of basics of Manufacturing processes - Casting, Machining, Sheetmetal


Basic knowledge of Microsoft Office


Relevant design experience of Machines


Benefits

Latest technology in Machine building


Opportunity to learn from Industry leaders


Join Marshall Machines as a Design Engineer and be a part of the cutting-edge technology in Machinery Manufacturing. Apply now and take your career to new heights!
